description.short: This game extension will put mod files with file extension "txt" in the Binaries folder.  Unfortunately, mod designers do not always use the "txt" extension for their mod files.
description.long:
This game extension will put mod files with file extension "txt" in the Binaries folder.  Unfortunately, mod designers do not always use the "txt" extension for their mod files.  For mods that do not have the "txt" file extension, there will usually be a readme file included with the mod that will tell you how to install the mod.
This game extension was tested with the Epic Games version of the game, but should also work with the Steam version of the game.

This game extension will allow you to start the game inside of Vortex; however, the Epic Games version of the game requires you to first start the Epic Games Launcher.  I did not add the Epic Games Launcher to the extension so that it will be more compatible with the Steam version, which does not require a separate launcher.

description.short: Quickly compare which mods you have enabled between two profiles.
description.long:
Description

With this extension you can select a "reference profile" from the "Profiles" screen. Then on the Mods table you should have a second column that shows the status of each mod in the reference profile so you can compare them side by side.
Please note that the buttons in that new column are functional, you can enable/disable in the reference profile.

Installation

This extension requires Vortex 1.3.x. You can install it by going to Extensions->Find more and there look for "Compare Profiles"

description.short: Vortex extensions for file previews using WinMerge (and similar diff tools.)
description.long:
[b][size=3]Description[/size][/b]

With this extension installed, when you click "Preview" on a file conflict, it will open the two files in WinMerge to give you a direct comparison between the two.
WinMerge ([url=https://winmerge.org/]https://winmerge.org/[/url]) has to be installed (duh!).
If WinMerge is installed in a non-default location you have to set the correct path in Settings->Tools.
You can also use other visual diff tools as long as they support the same command line parameters (listing the files to compare as the only parameters), Beyond Compare ([url=https://scootersoftware.com/]https://scootersoftware.com/[/url]) works great as well.

[b][size=3]Installation[/size][/b]

This extension requires Vortex >1.2.13. You can install it by going to Extensions->Find more and there look for "Preview WinMerge"

description.short: A generic installer for Unreal Engine games. Configurable using the details pane of your game extension.
description.long:
A generic installer for Unreal Engine games. Configurable using the details pane of your game extension.

[size=4]For users
[/size]This extension will be a requirement for certain other game extensions that utilise it. Vortex will automatically install this extension as required.

[size=4]For developers
[/size]If you're looking into creating a Vortex extension for a game which uses Unreal Engine 4, this extension may cut down on the workload required to get everything working. 

Unreal Engine games [i]generally[/i] follow a simple modding pattern. PAK files can be placed in a ~mods or ~mod folder (usually located at {root}\{gamename}\Content\Paks) and be loaded in alphabetical order. Subfolders within these directories are also loaded alphabetically. 

[b]What this extension does:
[/b][list]
[*]Adds two Mod Types, one for standard UE4 mods and another for UE4 mods including Load Order support. 
[*]Adds a general installer which will detect the mods by the PAK files (or another extension you provide) and assign them the appropriate mod type.
[*]If a mod archive is installed with more than one PAK file, Vortex will show a dialogue where the user can choose which of the PAKs to install. 
[/list]
[b]How to use it: [/b][list]
[*]Add this line to your extension's main function to tell Vortex you need this library installed 'context.requireExtension('Unreal Engine Game Library');'
[*]Inside your game object used in context.registerGame(), make sure to include a 'compatible' property. Inside the object passed there, you need to add 'unrealEngine: true', this tells the extension that you wish to use this library, 
[*]You also need to add an unrealEngine key to the 'details' section including the following values:
[list]
[*]modsPath - the path to install mods, relative to the install folder of the game. e.g. /Soulcaliburvi/Content/Paks/~mods
[*]absModsPath - Optional, if the mods folder isn't inside the game install folder, you can define it here. Use only modsPath OR adsModsPath. 
[*]fileExt - Optional, if you want to check for something other than a PAK file.
[*]loadOrder - Optional, if true this implies you plan to include a Load Order page. Setting this to true without a load order page will have a minor performance impact. 
[/list][/list]

[url=https://github.com/Pickysaurus/vortex-unreal-engine-library/blob/master/example/game-example/index.js]You can view a template extension here, which should only require you to change the variables at the top of the index.js file and add some appropriate game artwork.[/url]

description.short: Adds mod management and load order support for Soul Calibur VI to Vortex
description.long:
This extension adds Soul Calibur VI as a game supported in Vortex, for mod management and load ordering. This extension is an example for use of the "Unreal Engine Installer" library which simplifies creating game extensions for UE4 games. 


[b]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Soul Calibur VI in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[*]If prompted to install "Unreal Engine Installer" click "Fix" and restart Vortex again. 
[/list]
[b]
Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[*]If prompted to install "Unreal Engine Installer" click "Fix" and restart Vortex again. 
[/list]
[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\soulcalibur6.

description.short: Record a video of the Vortex window with the press of a hotkey.
description.long:
[size=3][b]Description[/b][/size]

With this extension installed you can press ctrl+r to start recording a video of the Vortex window, pressing ctrl+r again will stop the recording and save the video to file.

This is intended to help create tutorials or create a recording of a problem you encounter.

Please note that this extension isn't particularly smart, it will not automatically stop recording before running out of memory or anything, if you forget to stop the recording it may continue eating memory until you run out.

Further note: The recording quality is set fairly low so that files don't get too big. If this is a problem for you, please let me know.

[size=3][b]Installation
[/b][/size]
Go to Extensions->Find more and look for "Screen Recorder".

description.short: Adds support for Control to Vortex.
description.long:
Adds support for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/control]Control[/url] to Vortex.

Supports automatic detection of nested mod folders.

If any of the following mod folders are present: [code]data_pc[/code], [code]data[/code] or [code]plugins[/code], they will automatically be recognized as the archive root and be installed into their corresponding folders in the game's installation directory.

If none of these folders are present (e.g. raw DLL mod), then the original archive root will be used as the root directory and contents of the mod will simply be copied into the game's installation directory as-is.

description.short: Por fin,!! después de varios años (desde 2018) teniendo una traducción que no abarca ni el 20% de este estupendo administrador, vengo yo y me sumerjo en esta LOCURA de traducción para todas las personas de habla hispana sin conocimientos de ingles, pereza, o simplemente por que quieren tener el programa en español. Ya era Hora!!
description.long:
[center][/center][center][b]﻿This is a translation from Vortex to Spanish, but if your native language is another one and you want, this is also for you, thank you for visiting this site where everyone is welcome.


[size=6][color=#ff0000][u]POR FAVOR, LEER EL MENSAJE PEGAJOSO (FIJADO) PARA INSTALAR LA TRADUCCIÓN [b][size=6][b][size=6][color=#ff0000]EN LA PESTAÑA [b][size=6][b][size=6][color=#ff0000]"POSTS" (MENSAJES)[/color][/size][/b][/size][/b][/color][/size][/b][/size][/b].[/u][/color][/size][/b]


[size=6][b][u]INTRODUCCIÓN

[/u][/b][/size][color=#e69138]Hola a todos y bienvenidos a esta página donde encontraréis la traducción al Español para [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]﻿ compatible con su última versión 1.5.0[/color]
[color=#e69138]Tengo que decir que no ha sido nada fácil para mi, ya que no es una traducción normal como la de un mod común a los que ya después de varios años traduciendo estoy habituado con las aplicaciones apropiadas como [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/134][/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/134]xTranslator[/url]﻿, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/921]ESP-ESM Translator[/url]﻿, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37981]SSEEdit[/url]﻿ [color=#e69138]entre otros.
[/color][color=#e69138]Espero que valoren mi trabajo y me ayuden con críticas constructivas a corregir aquellos errores que haya podido cometer, ya que es mucho texto envuelto en programación para .Json, y por mucho que revise después de tener los ojos cansados me habré saltado algo seguro metiendo la pata.
[/color][color=#f6b26b]Creo que somos muchos los que utilizamos esta estupenda herramienta y nos merecemos tenerla en nuestro idioma, así creo que a muchos le ahorraré no tener que estar investigando ese error que dio [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]﻿ y no tenemos idea de que dice ni por que lo dice. También ayudará a comprender mejor el funcionamiento del programa y que nadie se vuelva loco buscando videos por las redes sociales para ver como se hace cualquier cosa dentro de este magnifico administrador sin romper nuestro juego.
Espero sinceramente ayudar a la gente de esta comunidad, que aunque sinceramente pocos aprecian el trabajo de los creadores de mods, programas y traducciones merece la pena ayudar a la gente dentro de nuestras posibilidades.
Este tiempo lo he dedicado libremente, por lo que nadie me ha pagado absolutamente nada. Nadie me ha contratado, no tengo ningún privilegio dentro de Nexus [/color][color=#ffe599]([/color][color=#f6b26b]ni siquiera tengo la cuenta premium[/color][color=#ffd966])[/color][color=#f6b26b] ni trabajo en el proyecto [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]﻿.
La que ha pagado este esfuerzo ha sido mi hija, ya que lo hice todo desde su pc y ella también ha puesto su semilla al renunciar a su tiempo de ocio por que su padre está haciendo algo para los demás.
No puedo imaginar el gran trabajo que hace el equipo de este administrador, yo solamente lo he traducido y uff...
Si te has leído todo esto ya has participado al menos un poco y no he escrito como un loco para que nadie lo lea.[/color]
[color=#dd7e6b][size=5][b]Gracias!!!

[/b][/size][/color][/center][center][b][u][size=6]POR QUE VORTEX?

[/size][/u][/b][/center][center][color=#e69138]﻿Si a estas alturas aún me lo preguntas creo que no lo has utilizado y si lo has hecho no has comprendido toda su utilidad, sencillez y uso, siendo práctico y efectivo, haciendo aquello para lo que ha sido programado casi a la perfección.
Todos somos libres de utilizar aquellas herramientas con las que nos sentimos más cómodos o nos produzcan más confianza, por que todo el mundo habla bien de ellas o por lo que sea. A mi nadie me hablo de [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]﻿! solo veía como todo el mundo utilizaba otros programas, en las redes se les daba bombo a otros.
Pensé que quería probar esta herramienta para ver si realmente es como muchos decían por ahí que era una "kk"  y así tener mi propio criterio sobre este gestor [/color][color=#ffd966]([/color][color=#e69138]no siempre es mejor lo que se grita por ahí[/color][color=#ffd966])[/color]
[color=#e69138]No quiero que la pestaña de post se llene de mensajes como: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]﻿ es una KK, es mucho mejor MO, NMM o cualquier otro que utilices, por favor ahórrate el comentario, cada uno tenemos nuestros gustos.


[/color][b][u][size=5]QUE DIFERENCIA HAY ENTRE ESTA TRADUCCIÓN Y LA OTRA QUE YA HAY?
[/size][/u][/b][color=#e69138]Haz la prueba tu mismo, instala Vortex y selecciona Español-Castellano, después instala mi complemento, verás la diferencia![/color]


[b][u][size=6]PROBLEMAS CONOCIDOS

[/size][/u][/b][color=#e69138]Púes sí, hay algún que otro problema conocido que no he conseguido solucionar [/color][color=#ffd966]([/color][color=#e69138]textos que aún te saldrán en ingles, [/color][color=#ffd966]pocos)[/color]
[color=#e69138]Una de las complejidades de traducir este gestor es que muchos de los textos están divididos o acompañados de códigos que llaman a un icono, enlace o acción para que aparezca al lado de ese texto, por ejemplo:  en el texto [/color][color=#ffe599]"Drop File(s)"[/color][color=#e69138] [/color][color=#ffd966]([/color][color=#e69138]Donde sueltas los archivos comprimidos para instalar los mods de forma manual en la pestaña MODS) viene como[/color][color=#ffe599] "([/color][color=#ffe599]Drop {{ accept }})"[/color][color=#e69138] y por otro lado [/color][color=#ffe599]"File(s)" [/color][color=#e69138]y esto complica mucho las cosas ya que casi tienes que estar adivinando como puede enlazarse para que reconozca la traducción.


[/color][b][size=6][u]INSTALACIÓN[/u]
[b][size=6][color=#ff0000][u]POR FAVOR, LEER EL MENSAJE PEGAJOSO (FIJADO) PARA INSTALAR LA TRADUCCIÓN EN LA PESTAÑA "POSTS" (MENSAJES).[/u][/color][/size][/b]


[/size][/b][color=#fff2cc][u][s]METODO 1[/s][/u][s]  ([/s][/color][s][color=#cc0000][size=4][b]DESCARGAR CON METODO 2 o 3[/b][/size][/color][b][color=#fff2cc]) 
 [/color][color=#ff7700]Este quizás en un futuro[/color][/b][/s][/center][center][s][size=3][b]1[/b][color=#e69138]-Descarga e instala [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url]
[b]2[/b][color=#e69138]-Descarga esta traducción desde esta página con el administrador de descargas. Si no tienes el programa abierto se abrirá y te pedirá permiso para descargar la traducción.
[/color][b]3[/b]- [color=#e69138]En la pestaña de la izquierda [/color][color=#ffd966]"EXTENSIONS"[/color][color=#e69138] activa la traducción (si no está activada) y pulsa en un botón que te saldrá arriba a la derecha [/color][color=#ffd966]"(Restart)"[/color][color=#e69138] para que reinicie vortex y se apliquen los cambios.[/color]
[b]4[/b][color=#e69138]-Dentro de [/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/1]vortex[/url][color=#e69138] cuando se reinicie a la izquierda pulsa en la pestaña[/color] [color=#ffd966]"SETTINGS" [/color][color=#e69138]luego arriba a la izquierda en[/color][color=#ffd966] "INTERFACE" [/color][color=#e69138] selecciona el idioma dentro de la casilla [/color][color=#ffd966]"Language"  [/color][/size][color=#e69138][b][size=3]YA ESTÁ!![/size]
[/b][/color]

[b][color=#fff2cc][size=4][u]METODO 2 (Semi-Manual)[/u][/size][/color]
[size=3]1-[/size][/b][size=3][color=#e69138]Haz los pasos anteriores 1 y 2 solo que esta vez en el paso 2 haz la descarga manual.[/color]
[b]2-[/b][color=#e69138]Abre la pestaña [/color][color=#ffd966]"EXTENSIONS"[/color] [color=#e69138]en el panel de la izquierda, después pincha abajo a la derecha donde pone[/color] [color=#ffd966]"Drop File(s)"[/color] [color=#e69138]y busca el archivo comprimido donde lo descargaste, selecciónalo y pulsa en "OPEN" o suelta el archivo comprimido de la traducción ahí [/color][color=#ffd966]([/color][color=#ffd966]"Drop File(s)")[/color]
[b]3-[/b][color=#e69138] Activa la traducción (si no está activada) y pulsa en un botón que te saldrá arriba a la derecha [/color][color=#ffd966]"(Restart)"[/color][color=#e69138] para que reinicie vortex y se apliquen los cambios.
[/color][color=#ffd966][b]Nota: Si el botón no aparece reinicia vortex de forma manual cerrando y abriendo el programa
[/b][/color][b]4-[/b] [/size][color=#e69138][size=3]Sigue el paso cuatro del método anterior[/size][/color][/s][color=#e69138]


[/color][/center][center][color=#fff2cc][size=4][b][u]METODO 3 (Manual)[/u][/b][/size][/color]
[size=3][b]1[/b]- [color=#e69138]Haz el paso 1 del método  anterior (Semi-manual)
[/color][b]2[/b][/size]-[size=3] [color=#f6b26b]Abre la siguiente ruta sin comillas en tu explorador de carpetas de windows[/color] [/size]"[color=#fff2cc]C:\Users\[/color][b][color=#ff0000]TU NOMBRE DE USUARIO[/color][/b]\[color=#fff2cc]AppData\Roaming\Vortex\locales[/color]" 
[size=3][b]3[/b]-[color=#e69138] Extrae el contenido de la traducción dentro de esa carpeta.[/color][/size]
[size=3][b]4-[/b][/size] [size=3][color=#e69138]Inicia el programa y a[/color][color=#e69138] la izquierda pulsa en la pestaña[/color] [color=#ffd966]"SETTINGS" [/color][color=#e69138]luego arriba a la izquierda en[/color][color=#ffd966] "INTERFACE" [/color][color=#e69138] selecciona el idioma dentro de la casilla [/color][color=#ffd966]"Language"  [/color][/size][color=#e69138][b][size=3]YA ESTÁ!!

[/size][/b][/color][b]DESDE LA APLICACIÓN
[/b]Implementado 23/09/2020
[color=#f6b26b][size=3]Antes de seguir los 4 pasos que añado en la imagen de abajo asegúrate de desinstalar cualquier otra traducción al español castellano que tengas instalada, ya sea en Extensiones (Extensions) o manualmente en: [/size][size=2] [/size][/color][size=2]C:\Users\[color=#ff0000][b]TU NOMBRE DE USUARIO[/b][/color][color=#f6b26b]\[/color]AppData\Roaming\Vortex\locales
[/size]
[img]https://sites.google.com/site/lawebdexlwarrior/_/rsrc/1600943491034/imagenes/Instalar2.png[/img]﻿

Muchas gracias compañero!!
[b]No olvides ir a su canal y dar vuestro apoyo con un like!!

[/b]
[youtube]CvRsAZB4omo[/youtube][/center][center]﻿[/center][center][b][u][size=6]AGRADECIMIENTOS

description.short: Adds support for installing and managing Into the Breach mods with Vortex.
description.long:
[size=4]Into the Breach support for Vortex[/size]

This extension adds support for Into the Breach mods to the Vortex mod manager.

[quote]This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find![/quote]

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple Vortex extension that adds support for Into the Breach mods so that you can install game mods using the Vortex mod manager.

Using Vortex you can install, manage, track and uninstall mods for Into the Breach just like you install mods for any of your other Vortex-supported games.

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You should be able to immediately install the extension by finding Into the Breach in your Vortex Games list and clicking Manage. Otherwise, install it directly from the Extensions pane, by clicking Find More and searching for "Into the Breach".

[i]Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension.[/i]

---

[b]Disclaimer[/b]: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods, nor with Subset Games.

description.short: Vortex support for Starsector v0.95a.
description.long:
---
NOTE: I no longer update this extension, although it should still work fine (as of 0.96a). I've created my own mod manager called SMOL (google it, probably against the rules to advertise it here) that has a number of tools specifically for Starsector. 
---
Includes support for mod version and author(s) for mods installed from file, rather than from Nexus Mods.

This extension will read mod_info.json, stripping out comments that use the '#' sign, and extract the mod version and mod author(s) from the file, allowing Vortex to display this useful information, which is normally limited only to mods that are downloaded from Nexus Mods.

Check for Updates will show updates for mods that have Version Checker support by providing a button to open the mod's forum page.

The displayed mod name will be unchanged (if downloaded from Nexus Mods) or the name of the mod's archive (if installed manually).
This is due to some mod authors releasing multiple iterations of a mod with
the same version, with the only difference being in the filename.
For example, "ModName-3.0.0-beta-1.zip" and "ModName-3.0.0-beta-2.zip" often both have a version of 3.0.0. Since the beta number is important information, it should not be replaced by the name in the mod_info.json file, which may simply be "Mod Name".

description.short:
Recent update to 5.1!
Significantly modified version of Swanndolia's lovely "Soft Dark and Classy" theme for Vortex - although, they don't look much the same...
This theme was designed to better match with my custom Desktop theme, not to look universally pretty; but feel free to download and use it if you like
description.long:
[size=3]Significantly modified version of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/users/38945460]Swanndolia[/url]'s lovely "[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/173]Soft Dark and Classy[/url]" theme for Vortex - although, they don't look much the same...

This theme was designed to better match with my custom Desktop theme, not to look universally pretty; but feel free to download and use it if you like.

This theme requires the lovely font Walkway, which is 100% free and [url=https://www.dafont.com/walkway.font]available here[/url], if you want to use this theme.
For clarity, you only need to install the font, [i]not place it in the theme's folder [/i]for instance.[/size]


[size=5]﻿To add this theme to Vortex:
[/size]
[size=4]For Windows Users:[/size]
[size=3]
Close Vortex if it's running, go to "[u]C:\Users\<Username>\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\themes[/u]", replacing <Username> with the name Windows knows you by (which was "User", for me), and copy the folder into there.
Do not place the zip file in there.
If you set a custom install location, the folder [i]may[/i] be elsewhere; I'm unsure.

[size=4] ﻿For Non-Windows Users:[/size]
[/size][size=3]
I'm happy for you, we need less people relying on Microsoft and their software - but I can't help here, sorry.

[size=4] ﻿For Users Updating from 5.0 to 5.1:
[/size]
Close Vortex.
Install the newest version as you would normally.
Run Vortex, and change your theme from "Ambrose Black and Clear 5.0" to "Ambrose Black and Clear".
[/size][size=2]The name change was made to make the any theoretical future updates clearer, as the version number in the theme name wouldn't be mismatched with the [i]actual[/i] version number.[/size]

description.short: An extension for Vortex Showcase that adds a handful of additional formats that you can use to share your mods including CSV, Discord and a more compact Markdown format.
description.long:
This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find! 

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple extension that adds a number of alternative formats to Showcase, allowing you to create more specialised showcases and share them more easily. These new formats integrate neatly and easily into Vortex Showcase so there's no additional steps.

There's plenty more information on what is and isn't available in [url=https://showcase.vortex.support/]the Showcase docs[/url], especially [url=https://showcase.vortex.support/docs/introduction/faq]the FAQ[/url].

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You can install the extension directly from Vortex's Extensions pane, or from the CI builds on GitHub. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go.

You can then create showcases just as you normally would (from either the top bar or action bar with mods selected) and choose any of the new formats in the dialog. You can then copy/save/share your showcase like usual.

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension so far.

---

[i]Disclaimer[/i]: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods

description.short: Extension that adds unofficial support for S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky to Vortex.
description.long:
[center][b][font=Verdana]Description[/font][/b][/center]

[font=Comic Sans MS]This extension will add [i][b]"S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky"[/b][/i] to list of games supported by [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i].[/font]

[center][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ff7700][b]Also, be sure to have full folder structure in [font=Georgia]"gamedata/configs"[/font], [font=Comic Sans MS]as game always checks entire folder for files. Even if it any not game related file. As Vortex, will create[/font] [font=Georgia]"__folder_managed_by_vortex" file[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]in folder it creates, you will have infinity loading bug. As i'm
mentioned above, game will try to read any file that located in[/font] [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]folder, include[/font] [font=Georgia]"__folder_managed_by_vortex"[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]file. (This happens only with[/font] [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]folder) I will also add fix for this, if you can't do this manually![/font][/b][/color][/font][/center]

[font=Verdana][b][center]How to install[/center][/b][/font]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Require [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] for this extension to work. There is 2 ways to install.
1. In [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] go to [b]"Extensions"[/b], click [b]"Find more"[/b] button, search for this extension.
2. Download manually from site and extract to [b]"C:/UserName/AppData/Roaming/Vortex/plugins"[/b]. Also you need "[b]Show hidden files and folders[/b]" set to on, before install this extension this way.[/font]

[b][font=Verdana][center]How this works[/center][/font][/b]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Similar as [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] supported mods, just add archive of any mod, then install it. Also, root folder in archive must be [b]"gamedata"[/b]([b]"database"[/b] for some mods) not [b]"FolderName/gamedata"[/b]

[b]You also can drag folders into "Drop File(s)" box, so Vortex will create "7z" archive for you.[/b]

Extension also have [b]FOMOD[/b] support, so if mod do have one, you can just probably drop that archive into [b]Vortex "Drop Files(s)[/b] box. Without repacking entire archive.[/font]

(This happens only with[/font] [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]folder) I will also add fix for this, if you can't do this manually![/font][/b][/color][/center]

[center][font=Verdana][b]How to install[/b][/font][/center]

description.short: This extension adds support for Project Wingman mods to the Vortex mod manager.
description.long:
[quote]This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find!
Some mod authors package their mods extremely unconventionally. Vortex should warn you about these incompatible mods.[/quote]
[size=5]What is it?[/size]
This is a simple Vortex extension that adds support for Project Wingman mods so that you can install game mods using the Vortex mod manager.
Using Vortex, you can install, manage, track and uninstall mods for Project Wingman just like you install mods for any of your other Vortex-supported games.

[size=5]A word of warning[/size]
Project Wingman is [i][b]very[/b][/i] new and there's likely to be a lot of changes, discoveries and tweaks made to how mods work (and are managed) in the coming months. Please be patient and report any issues you find as this is being built with zero inside knowledge of the game or modding processes.

[size=5]How to use it?[/size]
You can install the extension either from the Games tab in Vortex, or by installing it directly from Vortex's Extensions pane. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go.

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension.

description.short: Support for Outward
description.long:
[size=5][u]Usage[/u]
[/size]
[size=3]I recommend using a fresh installation of Outward if you want to use Vortex to manage your mods.
I also suggest installing BepInEx and PartialityWrapper with Vortex.

[/size][size=3] ﻿- Download the [url=https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx/releases]BepInEx [/url]and [url=https://github.com/sinai-dev/BepInEx-Partiality-Wrapper/releases]PartialityWrapper [/url].zip file corresponding to your system.
        - Go to the "Mods" tab on the left of Vortex
        - Drop the zip file on the bottom of the page
        - Install it like you would any other mod
[/size]
* In case the links above would be outdated, use those from [url=https://outward.gamepedia.com/Installing_Mods#BepInEx_Loader]Outward's Official Wiki[/url]﻿

[u][size=5]How it works[/size]
[/u]
[size=3]It checks if there is a[/size][b] BepInEx folder[/b][size=3] at the [/size][b]root [/b][size=3]of the zip file and if there are files in it or in its sub-folders. Basically, if you follow the current standard for BepInEx mods .zip files, it should work without issues.

[b]If the BepInEx Check is true,[/b] it copies the content in the outward folder, basically following the standard guidelines for installing bepinex mods[/size]
[quote][list=1]
[*][size=2]Download the Mod.zip file from the Files page[/size]
[*][size=2]Put this zip file in your Outward directory, so it looks like "Outward\Mod.zip"[/size]
[*][size=2]Right-click the file and "Extract Here", so it merges with the folders.[/size]
[*][size=2]Done![/size]
[/list][/quote]
[size=3][b]If the BepInEx Check is false[/b], it check if the zip file contains [b].dll, .xml or .json[/b] files. If it does, it [b]assumes it is a Partiality [/b]mod and copies every file in the [b]BepInEx/plugins [/b]folder.

if no .dll, .xml or .json files are found it throws an [b]"Incompatible Mod"[/b] error.

How the extension manages Partiality mods is a bit janky, but it should work for most of them.

If a partiality mod is not installed properly, you can make a new zip file with the .dll, .xml and .json in the BepInEx/plugins folder and the rest of the files placed correctly. Tthat way it will install it as a bepinex mod and should work.

[/size]The source code of my mods can be found here : [url=https://github.com/kikiwako/MyMods]GitHub[/url]

[font=Arial][font=Arial][font=Arial][font=Arial]
[b][i][color=#ffff00][size=5]v0.10.0-a "River"[/size][/color][/i][/b]

[i][u][b][size=3]Main Jobs

[/size][/b][/u][/i][list]
[*]✨ [b]Modlist File Support[/b] The latest cyberpunk update added a feature to redmod to allow deploying mods specified in a file. When we read that, we knew we had to get right on it to fully remove the mod count limit on REDmods (Eat it NetWatch!)
[/list][/font][/font][/font][/font][/font][/font][/font][font=Arial][size=4]
[url=https://github.com/E1337Kat/cyberpunk2077_ext_redux/releases/tag/v0.10.0-a]Full release notes here[/url]﻿ ↗️[/size][/font]

[font=Arial][font=Arial][size=4]
[b][i]Previous releases:[/i][/b][/size][/font][/font]

[size=2][i]v0.9.8[/i]

[i][u]Main Jobs
[/u][/i][/size][list]
[*][size=2]✨ Input Loader v0.1.1 Support (and you can still install v0.1.0, too, but shouldn't.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[i][u]Cyberdeck Upgrades aka Internal Stuff(tm)
[/u][/i][/size][list]
[*][size=2]?️ More Robust Load Order Protection There were some cases in which a race condition or unexpectedly deleted [font=Courier New]V2077/[/font] directory could cause the Load Order to be reset. Put a Cerberus on it, see 'em weefles try it now.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[font=Arial]v0.9.7
[/font][/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]Redscript mods can now include a hints file in `r6/config/redsUserHints/`[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
v0.9.6
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]Support ArchiveXL 1.3.4 structure[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
v0.9.5
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2] Autoconversion is off by default. Beware the mean reds.[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
v0.9.4
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]Spyder Murphy's Law The special archive handling in CET, Redscript, and Red4ext mods is gone, which means that now all archives can be autoconverted. (They're auto-convertible :get-it-doggo:)[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]Wear the Colors The few mods that were proactively splitting archives between REDmod  and classic now work correctly in the load order when autoconverted — both halves show up and can be independently ordered (they are still a single Vortex mod, though, so you can only enable or disable [i]both[/i].)[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
v0.9.3
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]cYbEr PuNk 2o77.Ex3 Since the 'case-insensitive' Windows filesystem doesn't actually _do_ a whole lot to guarantee any protection against any sort of problem, much like NCPD, there's a minor workaround to allow `cybercmd` to use case-sensitive comparison (until their fix is in.) To wit, we now spell `Cyberpunk2077` as `Cyberpunk2077`, not `cyberpunk2077`. Computers are great.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]? No more autoconvert tags in mod names to reduce the name length, which is actually becoming a problem with ~200 REDmods installed. This defers the problem slightly, and we'll address it in a more flexible way ASAP (hopefully with an update to redMod itself.)[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]DND: off! Show notifications for starting _and_ completing an on-demand REDdeployment (we changed the Net Architecture a bit to make this happen.)[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]

[font=Arial][font=Arial]v0.9.2[/font][/font]

[s][u][i]NOTE: cybercmd currently has an issue with the Launch Game button. Use the REDlauncher buttons or the launcher directly to run the game. [/i][/u][/s](fixed in v0.9.3)
[u][i]
Main Jobs[/i][/u]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]✨ ArchiveXL REDmod support! ArchiveXL can now be installed in REDmods, including for MultiType mods. Autoconversion from heirloom ArchiveXL is also supported both standalone and along with `.archive` files.[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[u][i]Fixer Gigs[/i][/u]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]? redMod.exe will now always deploy order-only changes too! The `redMod.exe` tool doesn't currently correctly handle cases where only the load order is changed without enabling/disabling mods at the same time. Until that's fixed upstream, Vortex will default to force deployment. It's unfortunately slower, but hopefully won't get in the way too much because it's running in the background.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]? REDmodding DLC check won't fail on non-store games![/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[u][i]Chippin' In - Tools of the Trade[/i][/u]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]⚒️ Run the game directly, `-modded`, no launcher. If you don't need the launcher, you can launch the game directly and still get the modded goodness (it's in the toolbar at the top, or on your dashboard.) [/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[font=Arial]v0.9.1[/font]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]? Tools from other games won't crash if user has our extension but the game is not installed. Until and if Vortex offers isolation from other games touching our stuff, we need to be extra careful not to touch any CP2077-specific stuff until we know that the user is actually invoking one of our tools.[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[i]v0.9 "Rogue"
[/i]
[i]Main Jobs[/i]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]✨ Full REDmod support! You can install and manage REDmods alongside all the others. *Note:* this is for new installations or reinstalls only. We don't want to accidentally break your existing mods, so you can choose when and if you want to migrate them yourself! Just hit Reinstall when you're ready.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]✨ Load Ordering! Drag and drop to order any mods that need ordering! Topmost is highest priority. Note that load order _only_ works on REDmods, and that the game will always load old-style archives at a higher priority and therefore override REDmods (this is where autoconversion comes in handy). Unmanaged REDmods are not supported at this time, so you'll need to reinstall them through Vortex to get everything to play nice together.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]✨ Autoconversion of old-style mods to REDmods! This is a [i]togglable[/i] feature (check out Settings), but we highly recommend that you leave it on unless there's an issue installing a mod.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]✨ Automatic REDmod deployment! Yep, no need to hit the terminal, every time you run a deployment in Vortex, your load order is deployed too. As soon as you see the notification that it's done, you can just start the game. And you can trigger a REDdeployment on-demand, too, at the click of a button in the toolbar.[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]✨ Jack right in! Finally, the default launch button will launch the game directly, with REDmods enabled. No need for the terminal or a separate launcher. If you [i]do[/i] want to go through the launcher (for achievements, perhaps), there's the REDlauncher Tool in your toolbar and dashboard that will do just that.[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[i][u]Fixer Gigs[/u][/i]
[/size][/font][list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]? All fixes we needed to make were released in v0.8.1, v0.8.2, and v0.8.3, this one's the big leagues.[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[i][u]Cyberdeck Upgrades aka Internal Stuff(tm)[/u][/i][/size][/font]
[list]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]? A major addition is the ability to define mod type data. In this release it's used to support REDmods, but in the future it can be used for things like true conflict checking, safe cleanup scripts for tricky mods, and so much more...[/size][/font]
[*][font=Arial][size=2]⚙️ All the internal changes and refactorings are too numerous to mention, but we were able to build on the foundation we'd already set up and make some major changes, and we've got some new foundations to build nova stuff on.[/size][/font]
[/list][font=Arial][size=2]
[url=https://github.com/E1337Kat/cyberpunk2077_ext_redux/releases/tag/v0.9.0]Full release notes here[/url] ↗️[/size]
[font=Arial][size=4]

[size=5][b][u][size=6]Installation[/size][/u]

You can install either through Vortex, or manually (required in some cases.)

A. Install through Vortex[/b][/size] (with automatic updates afterwards)

[u]Note: it takes a while for latest releases to be available this way. Check the version. If you need the newest version and it's not available yet, you can install it manually.[/u]

[size=3]You can either click on Install With Manager in files here on the mod page, or [/size]go directly to Extensions in the Vortex client

[/font][list]

[/list][list]

[/font][*]Restart if prompted to
[*]Done! And Vortex will automatically update the extension (but be aware there may be a brief delay so in some cases you may want to manually install the latest version.)
[/list][font=Arial][b]
[size=5]B. Install Manually[/size][/b]

[/font][list=1]
[*][font=Arial]Download the version you want in Files, save the zipfile to disk[/font]
[*][font=Arial]In Vortex, go to Extensions, find Cyberpunk 2077 and right-click to remove it[/font]
[*][font=Arial]Restart Vortex as prompted[/font]
[*][font=Arial]Go back to Extensions, and either dragndrop the zipfile to the bottom right (or click bottom right to open a file selection dialog), see below:[/font]
[*][font=Arial]Restart Vortex as prompted[/font]
[*][font=Arial]Read any notes shown (if any)[/font]
[*][font=Arial]Click on Select Game to Manage or go to Games, and activate Cyberpunk 2077[/font]
[*][font=Arial]Done![/font]

[/list]
[list]
[font=Arial][img]data:image/png;base64,[/img][/font][/list][font=Arial]



[b][size=5]To Uninstall:[/size]

[/b]Click Remove in the extensions list

Restart Vortex, the game should no longer be supported by Vortex.



[size=5]Reporting Issues, Feature Requests etc[/size].

If possible, [url=https://github.com/E1337Kat/cyberpunk2077_ext_redux/issues/new/choose]make reports and requests on Github[/url]. You can also use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/196?tab=bugs]Nexus bugs[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/196?tab=posts]Nexus posts[/url], or reach us[url=https://discord.gg/redmodding] on the CP2077 Modding Community Discord[/url] (#vortex-support).

To help us fix and add things, please:

[list=1]
[*]Make sure you've read the usage information here[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/196][/url]

[*]Make sure you've read any instructions that the mod you're trying to install comes with
[*]Try to reproduce the problem so that you can tell us how to reproduceit
[/list]
﻿4. Include the log files
[list]
[*] Vortex logs can be found under the triple dot in the upper right corner, Diagnostic Files, find the right timeframe to show the problem/error from the list, check all four boxes (including Debug!), and then copy to clipboard.
[*]Redmod log is located in [b][u]<gamedir>/tools/redmod/bin/redmod.log[/u][/b]
[/list][/font][font=Arial][list=1]

[/list]

description.short: Adds Vortex support for Noita
description.long:
[b][size=5]1. Overview[/size][/b]

Adds basic support for modding Noita with Vortex.

The extension extracts the mod archive into the mod folder in your Noita installation directory.

The extension also supports mods archives downloaded from websites other than nexusmods, streamlining the installation process.

[b][size=5]2. Installation[/size][/b]
[size=4]2.1 From Vortex[/size]
[list=1]
[*]In Vortex, go to "Extensions"
[*]Click the "Find more" button and search for this extension
[*]Install it.
[/list]
[size=4]2.2 Manually (OR if it doesn't show up in the extensions list)[/size]
[list=1]
[*]Download from the site
[*]Extract it into "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\plugins"
[*]It will show up in the extensions when you restart vortex
[/list]
[b][size=5]3. Usage
[/size][/b]To use the extension, drag and drop the mods into the mods tab in vortex. It supports mods downloaded from nexusmods as well as other sites (e.g. modworkshop)

[b][size=5]4. Uninstallation
[/size][/b]To uninstall, click "remove" in the extensions tab and restart vortex.

Let me know if you experience any bugs or issues.

description.long: Support for Baldur's Gate 3

description.short: so, a lot of people complain about vortex sizing issues. this will fix it.
description.long:
note: you can open 2 tabs simultaneously by ctrl+clicking a tab. for instance, the picture is mods tab selected and ctrl+click plugins tab.

this is based upon the burgundy theme by picky, combined with the compact theme by kit (original vortex designer) and a few tweaks to make side-by-side work better.

[list=1]
[*]Open the skin directory of Vortex: [code]%APPDATA%\Vortex\Themes[/code]
[*]Extract the .zip into this directory.
[*]Open Vortex and navigate to Settings -> Themes and select [code]Burgundy compact ygg[/code]
[/list]This is a theme, themes for vortex come in 2 parts: Style.scss and variables.scss. if you like the updated layout but not the colors, then you can clone your current theme and move the style.scss into the folder. if you like the colors but not the style, clone your existing theme and put the variables.scss into the folder but not the style.scss

description.short: Extension that adds unofficial support for Jurassic World Evolution to Vortex.
description.long:
[b][center][font=Verdana]Description[/font][/center][/b]

[font=Comic Sans MS]This extension will add [i][b]"Jurassic World Evolution"[/b][/i] to list of games supported by [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i].[/font]

[font=Verdana][b][center]How to install[/center][/b][/font]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Require [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] for this extension to work. There is 2 ways to install.
1. In [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] go to [b]"Extensions"[/b], click [b]"Find more"[/b] button, search for this extension.
2. Download manually from site and extract to [b]"C:/UserName/AppData/Roaming/Vortex/plugins"[/b]. Also you need "[b]Show hidden files and folders[/b]" set to on, before install this extension this way.[/font]

[center][b][font=Verdana]How this works[/font][/b][/center]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Similar as [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] supported mods, just add archive of any mod, then install it. Also, root folder in archive must be [b]"Win64"[/b] ([b]"Movies"[/b] for some mods) not [b]"FolderName/Win64"[/b][/font].

[b][font=Verdana][center]Additional information[/center][/font][/b]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Also always be sure there is correct folder structure, so [b]Vortex[/b] can correctly install mod. If downloaded mod don't have correct folder structure (or not have it at all) you should do it by yourself!

[b]You also can drag folders into "Drop File(s)" box, so Vortex will create "7z" archive for you.[/b]

Extension also have [b]FOMOD[/b] support, so if mod do have one, you can just probably drop that archive into [b]Vortex "Drop Files(s)[/b] box. Without repacking entire archive.[/font]

description.short: Vortex support for Subnautica: Below Zero
description.long:
[size=6]Subnautica: Below Zero Support for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url][/size][line]

[size=5]Description[/size][line]

[size=3]This extension adds support for Subnautica: Below Zero to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex Mod Manager[/url], enabling you to easily automate installation of mods for Subnautica: Below Zero without having to worry about where the files are supposed to go, etc.

At this time, the following mod types are supported:

[/size][list]
[*][size=3]BepInEx Pack for Subnautica: Below Zero[/size]
[*][size=3]BepInEx plugins[/size]
[*][size=3]BepInEx patchers[/size]
[*][size=3]QModManager[/size]
[*][size=3]QMods[/size]
[*][size=3]CustomHullPlates addon packs[/size]
[*][size=3]CustomPosters addon packs[/size]
[/list]
[size=3]If you are developing a different kind of mod and would like it to be supported by this extension, please [url=https://github.com/toebeann/subnautica-below-zero-support/issues]raise an issue or pull request on the GitHub repository[/url] with a link to your mod page so that I can take a look at how you are packaging it. Please make sure to include instructions for how you would expect it to be installed, so that I can have Vortex automate the process. PRs welcome![/size]

[size=5]How to install[/size][line]

[size=3]This extension requires [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] ^1.9.0. To install, click the Vortex button at the top of the page to open this extension within Vortex, and then click [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Install[/font]. Alternatively, within Vortex, go to the [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Extensions[/font] tab, click "[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Find More[/font]" at the bottom of the tab, search for "Subnautica Below Zero Support" and then click [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Install[/font].

You can also manually install it by downloading the main file and dragging it into the "drop zone" labelled "[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Drop File(s)[/font]" in the [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Extensions[/font] tab at the bottom right.

Afterwards, restart Vortex and you can begin installing supported Subnautica: Below Zero mods with Vortex.[/size]

[line]
[center]﻿[size=5][b]The rest of this page is intended for mod authors only.
Users can simply follow the instructions above to install, and you're done![/b][/size]

[url=https://ko-fi.com/toebean_][img]https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/5c14e387dab576fe667689cf/61e11d503cc13747866d338b_Button-2-p-800.png[/img][/url]﻿[/center][line]

[size=5]How to make my mod compatible with this extension?[/size][line]

[size=3]Assuming your mod is of a supported type, simply follow the packaging examples for that mod type below.

Don't forget to set your latest main file as your main Vortex file, and make sure that the "[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Remove the 'Download with Manager' button[/font]" option is unticked!

If your mod is not of a supported type, you will need to [url=https://github.com/toebeann/subnautica-below-zero-support/issues]raise an issue or pull request on the GitHub repository[/url] with a link to your mod page so that I can take a look at how you are packaging it. Please make sure to include instructions for how you would expect it to be installed.[/size]

[size=4]Packaging examples[/size]

[size=3]BepInEx plugins[/size]

Any of the following structures are valid:

[code]﻿- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]
[code]﻿- My BepInEx Plugin
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]
[code]- plugins
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]
[code]- plugins
- My BepInEx Plugin
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]
[code]- BepInEx
- plugins
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]
[code]- BepInEx
- plugins
- My BepInEx Plugin
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]

[size=3]BepInEx patchers[/size]

Any of the following structures are valid:

[code]- patchers
- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
[/code]
[code]- patchers
- My BepInEx Patcher
- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
[/code]
[code]- BepInEx
- patchers
- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
[/code]
[code]- BepInEx
- patchers
- My BepInEx Patcher
- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
[/code]

[size=3]BepInEx plugin/patcher combos[/size]

Any of the following structures are valid:

[code]- patchers
- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
- plugins
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]
[code]- patchers
- My Mod Name
- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
- plugins
   - My Mod Name
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]
[code]- BepInEx
- patchers
- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
- plugins
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]
[code]- BepInEx
- patchers
- My Mod Name
- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
- plugins
    - My Mod Name
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]

[size=3]QMods[/size]

Any of the following structures are valid:

[code]- My QMod
- mod.json
- MyQMod.dll
[/code]
[code]- QMods
- My QMod
- mod.json
- MyQMod.dll
[/code]
[code]- mod.json
- MyQMod.dll
[/code]

[size=3]Mods which can be installed as either a QMod or a BepInEx plugin[/size]

Mods which meet all of the following criteria are eligible to be installed as either a QMod or a BepInEx plugin:

[list]
[*]has a mod.json manifest for QModManager
[*]has an assembly containing a BaseUnityPlugin class with a BepInPlugin attribute applied to it
[*]has the following structure:
[code]- My Mod
- mod.json
- MyMod.dll
[/code][/list]When a user installs an eligible mod, they will be prompted to choose whether they would like to install it for QModManager or BepInEx. The one exception to this rule is when the user only has BepInEx installed but not QModManager, to prevent bugging them with annoying questions. In this case, the mod will automatically be installed as a BepInEx plugin.


[size=3]CustomHullPlates addon packs[/size]

Any of the following structures are valid. Note that although these examples only include a single hull plate, the extension will happily install packs containing multiple hull plates.

[code]- CustomHullPlates
- HullPlates
- MyHullPlate
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]
[code]- HullPlates
- MyHullPlate
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]
[code]- MyHullPlate
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]

[size=3]CustomPosters addon packs[/size]

Any of the following structures are valid. Note that although these examples only include a single poster, the extension will happily install packs containing multiple posters.

[code]- CustomPosters
- Posters
- MyPoster
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]
[code]- Posters
- MyPoster
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]
[code]- MyPoster
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]

[size=3]Mixed CustomHullPlates/CustomPosters addon packs[/size]

Any of the following structures are valid. Note that although these examples only include a single hull plate and poster each, the extension will happily install packs containing multiple of each.

[code]- CustomHullPlates
- HullPlates
- MyHullPlate
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
- CustomPosters
- Posters
- MyPoster
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]
[code]- HullPlates
- MyHullPlate
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
- Posters
- MyPoster
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]
[code]- MyHullPlate
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
- MyPoster
- icon.png
- info.json
- texture.png
[/code]

[size=3]My mod is being installed strangely![/size]

If you have followed the packaging examples above and your mod is still being incorrectly installed by this extension, please [url=https://github.com/toebeann/subnautica-below-zero-support/issues]raise an issue on the GitHub repository[/url] with a link to your mod page or with a sample archive attached so that I can get it fixed.

description.short: Adds support for installing and managing Beat Saber mods with Vortex
description.long:
BeatVortex adds support for installing and managing Beat Saber mods through Vortex. You can use Vortex to install mods alongside Mod Assistant or any other Beat Saber modding tools.

Find full documentation on using Vortex with Beat Saber at [url=https://beatvortex.dev]beatvortex.dev[/url]

[size=5]Installation[/size]

You should be able to automatically install the extension by clicking Manage on Beat Saber in the Games list, just like your other Vortex games. If that doesn't work, you can install the extension directly using the Find More button at the bottom of the Extensions screen: just find Beat Saber Support and Install it.

[size=5]Adding Beat Saber[/size]

Once the extension is installed, Vortex should automatically discover Beat Saber in the "Discovered" tab of the Games screen. Click Manage to perform initial setup and add Beat Saber to your games list.

[size=5]Installing Mods[/size]

Just like any other Vortex game, installing mods from archives is pretty simple: download the zip file, drag-and-drop into Vortex, then Install and Enable the mod.

[size=5]BeatMods[/size]

Since v0.2.0, you can quickly browse and install mods from BeatMods without leaving Vortex. Open the new BeatMods page from the left sidebar to see all the currently available mods for your game version.

[size=5]OneClick[/size]

Since v0.2.0, you can enable our preview support for OneClick installs from your Vortex settings. Open the Download tab in Settings, scroll down to "Enable OneClick Installations" and you can individually enable OneClick link handling for maps, models or playlists. You can then use the OneClick links on BeatSaver, BeastSaber and ModelSaber to install mods with Vortex. See [url=https://beatvortex.dev/docs/usage/mods/]beatvortex.dev[/url] for more information on OneClick installation.

description.short: Easily build and upload your modlists to Modwatch directly from Vortex. Powered by Vortex Showcase.
description.long:
[quote]Find the full documentation at [url=https://modwatch.vortex.support]modwatch.vortex.support[/url]﻿[/quote]
This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find! 

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple extension that adds support for building and uploading modlists based on your installed mods directly to Modwatch from Vortex. You can easily create and upload modlists for any supported game directly from the Vortex mods page without any external uploader.

There's plenty more information on what is and isn't available in [url=https://modwatch.vortex.support/]the docs[/url], especially [url=https://modwatch.vortex.support/docs/introduction/faq]the FAQ[/url].

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You can install the extension directly from Vortex's Extensions pane, or from the CI builds on GitHub. Restart Vortex and you should be good to go. If you don't have Showcase installed, Vortex will prompt you to install it.

You can then create and upload mod lists based on your enabled mods (from the top bar) of the mods page. You can also use the normal "Create Showcase" buttons to create a modlist for only a selection of mods (check [url=https://modwatch.vortex.support/docs/usage/]the docs [/url]for more details).

Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension so far.

---

[i]Disclaimer[/i]: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods, nor with Modwatch.

description.short: A better "Compact" theme that avoids the antipattern of things moving around when using the toolbar, and keeps the toolbar icons properly and consistently visible.
description.long:
Details in this thread - https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/7843418-suggestion-thread-for-vortex-improvements/page-3#entry72082243 - but the overview and screenshot cover everything important.


I stole these un/installation instructions from Pickysaurus. If they're good, thank him. If not, blame me.  :)


[size=6]Installation[/size]

Close Vortex before installing.

Open up "AppData\Roaming\Vortex\Themes".

[b][i]Note: If you used Shared mode under Settings -> Vortex your themes folder will be C:\ProgramData\vortex\themes[/i][/b]

Extract the archive [b][i]including the "bettercompact/" folder itself[/i][/b] into this directory.

Open Vortex and navigate to Settings -> Themes and select the "bettercompact" theme.


[size=6]Uninstallation[/size]

Ensure you change to a different theme than the one you wish to remove.

Close Vortex.

Open the themes folder.

Delete the "bettercompact" theme.

description.short: Adds support for Valheim.
description.long:
This extension adds support for Valheim to Vortex enabling you to install and uninstall mods for the game. 

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/?BH=0&RH_ModList=nav:true,home:false,type:0,user_id:0,game_id:3667,advfilt:true,include_adult:true,page_size:20,show_game_filter:false,open:true,tags_yes%5B%5D:4198]Vbuilds[/url] (pre-made structures/constructions) are also supported, but require [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/5]BuildShare (AdvancedBuilding)[/url] to be installed. Vortex will detect when BuildShare is needed and notify you, after which you can simply install it like any other mod.


[b]New in 1.0.5:[/b]

World Saves can now be installed like any other mod but will require the mod [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/446]Better Continents[/url] - Vortex will notify you of this requirement.

[i]Note on uninstalling/removing new World Saves:[/i]

To remove worlds you will need to disable them in Vortex AND delete them via the ingame menu.

Known issues: due to a bug with the game/synchronisation of files, Valheim will reinstate .old files for World Saves even after they've been deleted when the game is launched and synchronisation in Steam is enabled (default). This is not a Vortex issue and will happen even if new worlds are installed/created manually. This is not a critical bug as it won't do any harm other than take up some extra space on your hard drive.



[b][size=3]How to install[/size][/b]

Simply select "Valheim" from the games list and download the extension through Vortex. (Requires Vortex 1.1.0 or newer).


[b][size=3]If you have mods installed already[/size][/b]

It is recommended to use this extension on a vanilla (unmodded) game installation of Valheim. However, if you have already installed mods using BepInEx or InSlimVML, there should not be any problems as long as you did not manually rename any of the BepInEx/InSlimVML or data folders in your Valheim directory.


[b][size=3]Note on Valheim mods using InSlimVML[/size][/b]

[i]The following does not apply for the vast majority of Valheim mods which use BepInEx (rather than InSlimVML).[/i]

For mods requiring [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/21]InSlimVML[/url], please make sure you download and install it. This process works just like installing any other mod in Vortex. Vortex will notify you if it detects a mod that requires InSlimVML.

For mod authors:

If your mod is a plugin (rather than a vbuild) and needs [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/valheim/mods/21]InSlimVML[/url], please give your plugin a name using [b]a _VML suffix[/b]. For example, if your plugin is called MyMod.dll and it requires InSlimVML, please name it [b]MyMod_VML.dll[/b]. Vortex will read the suffix and know the mod needs to be deployed differently than a BepInEx mod.

For users:

If you are using a mod requiring InSlimVML (that is not a vbuild) that does not have the _VML suffix (so the name of the mod plugin is something like MyMod.dll rather than MyMod_VML.dll), you will need to change the modtype in Vortex to ensure the mod is deployed correctly. As of now this is a very rare use case.

To change the modtype:

[list=1]
[*]Open Vortex and select "MODS" in the side menu to bring up your mod list.
[*]Double-click on the mod you want to change.
[*]In the details panel that will pop up on the right side, scroll to the very bottom where you should see a "Mod Type" section with a dropdown.
[*]Select "InSlimVML Mod" from the dropdown.
[*]Deploy your mods (a notification should have been raised) via the notification or by clicking "Deploy Mods" in the toolbar.
[*]That's it! Enjoy your mod!
[/list]

description.short: Adds mod, plugin and savegame management for Enderal Special Edition to Vortex
description.long:
[center][b][color=#ff7700][size=3]Due to lack of support from the Enderal Special Edition dev team, this extension is no longer maintained. If you would like to update it the code is [url=https://github.com/Pickysaurus/vortex-game-enderal-se]open source on GitHub[/url]﻿. If you are developing an update and would like control of this page, please contact [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/31179975]Pickysaurus[/url]﻿. [/size][/color][/b][/center]

This extension adds Enderal Special Edition as a game supported in Vortex for mod management. This extension is can detect both the Steam and Nexus Mods installations.

[b]Features[/b]

[list]
[*]Automatic detection of missing dependencies (SkyUI, SKSE, FlatMapMarkers, JContainers) in the Nexus Mods install. 
[*]Automatically enables SkyUI and Enderal plugins if they have been disabled. 
[*]Pre-filled shortcut to the Enderal Launcher.
[*]Plugin management (requires Vortex 1.4.4+). 
[*]Savegame management (requires Vortex 1.4.4+). 
[/list]

[b]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Enderal Special Edition in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]
[b]Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list]
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\Enderal SE.

description.short: Some basic tweaks I made for the More MO2 like Vortex Theme that I wanted to share somewhere.
description.long:
[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Description
[/size][/color][/b]
Compact themes with easier to see colors, using [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/201]More MO2 like Vortex Theme[/url] as a baseline. Provided as-is.

See the images to decide if you might like to use one. Created for mostly personal use, and shared so I don't end up losing them if I ever need them later. I loved the original theme sets but my eyes didn't like the colors. I've used "burgundy mo2 interface no hover" as a base, and have tweaked colors and size sliders to suit my preferences. Of course you're more than welcome to further fiddle with the settings. I most likely won't be releasing any further versions, so if you want a specific color you'll have to mess with it yourself. The theme editor is fairly intuitive to use though so no worries.


[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Install & Uninstall
[/size][/color][/b]
Extract the 7z's folder(s) into User\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\themes to install.
If you ever want to uninstall, delete my themes' folders from the Vortex\themes folder.

description.short: Automatically assign Nexus Mods downloads to multiple games.
description.long:
Do you always have to confirm the game you're playing when installing mods? Perhaps you're playing Enderal, Skyrim VR, Fallout VR or XCOM2: War of the Chosen? Are you tired of this dialog?

[img]https://i.imgur.com/Mrtr9xS.png[/img]


With this extension you can teach Vortex to automatically mark games for one game as compatible with another, handy right?

Simply head to your Settings and scroll to the bottom of the downloads tab. Then add a new row to the table and next time you download a mod for one game, it'll be marked as compatible with the other! 

[img]https://i.imgur.com/W7Idof7.png[/img]

[b]Vortex Install (Super Easy)[/b]

description.short: Provides an easy way to quickly share/download/install mod setups between different Vortex instances
description.long:
[b][size=4][size=4][b]Important Notes:

[/b][/size][size=3]This extension is experimental and although it has been tested, some bugs may still be present - the extension is a personal project and is [b]NOT [/b]an official Nexus Mods extension, please report any issues you encounter on this extension page - please avoid reporting them through the internal feedback system.[/size]

What is this/How does it work ?

[/size][/b][size=3]This is an experimental Vortex extension which aims to give users the ability to automatically fulfill mod dependencies and/or share mod setups with other Vortex users. This extension allows users to "Export Dependencies" by selecting one or more mods from the mods table (Only mods downloaded through the Nexus Mods website are supported), Vortex will generate a JSON string containing all the information required to download the mods - this data can then be distributed to other users by standard copy-paste - the other users will then need to "Import Dependencies" through the action bar button in the mods page. (view gifs in image gallery)

Alternatively mod authors can distribute a generated dependency file with their mods which will immediately attempt to fulfill mod dependencies on successful mod installation (if the user enables this functionality in their settings page). The "Import Dependencies" button on the mods page can also be used to tell Vortex to search for dependency files within the current game's staging folder and attempt to fulfill them that way (for those of us that prefer full control over when the fulfillment system kicks in)

Although premium membership is highly recommended (mod download and installation is triggered automatically without any further input from the user), Non-Premium members can still benefit from this extension - Vortex will open a tab for each mod file's download page.

Example data:[/size]
[code][
  {
"archiveName": "BuildShare-5-1-4-0c-1614288309.zip",
"downloadIds": {
"fileId": 442,
"gameId": "valheim",
"modId": 5
},
"allowAutoInstall": true,
﻿"rules": []
  },
  {
"archiveName": "Better Continents-446-0-4-1-1616286717.zip",
"downloadIds": {
"fileId": 2343,
"gameId": "valheim",
"modId": 446
},
"allowAutoInstall": true,
﻿"rules": []
  }
]
[/code][size=4]
[b]What it doesn't do:

[/b][/size][list]
[*][size=3]Will not export mods sourced outside of NexusMods.com[/size]
[*][size=3]Will not export mods with orphaned/missing download archives[/size]
[*][size=3]Will not export manually added mods unless the mod's metadata is populated (use the "Guess Id" buttons to have Vortex identify your mod and pull the metadata for you)[/size]
[*][size=3]The auto-fulfill on install functionality will not use requirements defined within the mod page! (for auto-fulfill to work, the mod needs to have a ".vdeps" file included by the mod author)[/size]
[/list]
[b][size=4]How to install:[/size][/b]

[list]
[*][size=3]Find the "Dependency Fulfiller" extension inside Vortex's extensions page and install it from there. (If it's missing, refresh the extensions list manually or wait for Vortex to update it and try again)[/size]
[*][size=3]Clicking the "Vortex" button on this mod/extension page should open up the extensions page with the Dependency Fulfiller pre-selected - (again, if it doesn't show up or Vortex says it's unavailable - refresh the extensions list or wait for Vortex to refresh it)[/size]
[*][size=3](Not recommended) you can install the extension manually by downloading the archive and extracting it in your "%appdata%/vortex/plugins" folder. Please be aware that Vortex will not be able to automatically update the extension if you choose this method[/size]
[/list][size=3]
[/size][b][size=4]Feedback:[/size][/b]

[size=3]If you have a suggestion or an issue you would like to discuss please feel free to post on this project's github page [url=https://github.com/IDCs/dependency-fulfiller/issues]https://github.com/IDCs/dependency-fulfiller/issues[/url]﻿[/size]

description.short: Adds Vortex modding support for Resident Evil 8 (Village)
description.long:
[b]Important notes:
[list]
[*][b]Vortex 1.4.12 or newer is required for this game extension to function![/b]
[*]Absolutely NEVER use Vortex in combination with other Resident Evil mod managers unless you want to break your game!
[*]Do NOT close Vortex or run the game while a validation operation is running, no matter how long it takes - go make yourself a tea while you're waiting.
[*]This game extension cannot function with the RE8 Demo version of the game.
[/list][/b]
[size=4]Description[/size]

This game extension will add Vortex modding support for Resident Evil 8 (Village) - the extension will currently cater for all texture/mesh/ui replacement mods but will not support reshade mods or "hook" mods which are generally distributed in ".dll" format.

[size=4]Installation[/size]

Vortex Install (Easy)

[list]
[*]Inside Vortex, locate Resident Evil: Village in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it (download will be required), install the extension as prompted.
[*]Restart Vortex.
[/list]
Vortex Install (Advanced)

Please note that your game extension will not be automatically updated if you opt for this method and you risk to miss out on important bugfixes.

[list]
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

Manual Install

Same as the Advanced method, the game extension will not be automatically updated when using this method.

[list]
[*]Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\Resident Evil Village\
[/list]

description.short: Adds PAYDAY 2 support to Vortex, with management support for both BLT mods, mod_override mods, and custom maps. Created using Add Game Wizard.
description.long:
This extension adds support for PAYDAY 2 to Vortex and supports both both BLT mods, mod_override mods, and custom maps.

By default mods are detected and installed as BLT mods, for overwrite style mods or custom maps you will need to manually select the mod and change the Mod Type to Asset Override or Custom Map respectively.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/S7aPxQ5.png[/img]

Most mods [i]should[/i] work straight out of the box, but worst case you may need to play around with the folder structure for the mod to deploy properly.

[b]Huge thanks to [/b][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/85550163]agc93[/url] for helping me out with this on the Discord.[/b]

description.short: DLM - Dying Light Manager is a vortex extension that allows users to use vortex mod manger with Dying light.
description.long:
[size=6]Vortex Support Dying Light:[/size]
[size=5][b]Contact:
[/b]Need support or questions:
Discord:[b] [/b][url=https://discord.gg/qzJCrNd]LINK
[/url][/size]
[size=5][b]Version 0.0.2 features:[/b]
[/size][list]
[*][size=4]Vortex support to manage mods for Dying Light[/size]
[*][size=4]Make installation easier and better for mods[/size]
[*][size=4]Allows other mod authors to make [url=http://wiki.tesnexus.com/index.php/How_to_create_mod_installers]mod installers[/url]﻿ for vortex[/size]

[b][size=5]Instructions:[/size][/b]
Install from vortex or download from here. From there acts like another vortex extension, download the mods and play but please read down below if you have issues.


Troubleshooting:
If there [i]is[/i] a file conflict between two mods, the mod that deploys last wins the conflict. To see the deploy order you'll have to enable the columns for it.
[img]https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/865428831024185374/868083836775444500/unknown.png[/img]

You can control the deploy order using the dependencies column which allows you to define deployment rules as seen in the gif
[img]https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/866561832046952469/872673886385360976/ezgif-1-e93a9e9d8765.gif[/img]


If you still have problems or want to help me contact information above ^

Specials thanks to Journeyman since he has been the one that helped a lot. With out this lad we would not be this far so thank him if you ever get the chance. Also thanks to nexus staff for being so helpful.

[b]DEVELOPMENT[/b][size=5]:[/size]
[size=3]V0.0.2  Fixed it + added merging logic for pak mod[/size]

V0.0.1 Just getting out the door. Making it where people can now use vortex for the game. I plan to add more to make it more stable want to help me join my discord in contacts.

description.short: Adds support for Pak mods to Vortex Mod Manager; See full description for details.
description.long:
[size=4][b][u]Days Gone - Vortex Support[/u][/b]

[/size]This Vortex extension adds support for the Days Gone Steam version. 

It currently allows for:
- Install/Uninstall Mods
- Disable/Enable and Deploy Mods
- Custom Load Ordering
- Update Mods Directly In-Manager

Coming Soon:
- Custom Suggested Tools; these will be added as single-click launchers for common/useful tools for modding this game.


MOD AUTHORS: If you make mods for this game, and want your mods to be compatible, please ensure that you are using the .pak file format community standard that the rest of us use! If you need assistance with this, use one of the many tools available, or join the [url=https://discord.gg/kB4Zv98BSV]Days Gone Modding Discord[/url]. If your mod has multiple options, create an installer for it, to make it fully compatible with this system! [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/How_to_create_mod_installers]Information for this can be found here[/url]. Where it specifies to "add a folder", instead, select "add a file", and choose the appropriate .pak file for each option!

[u]IMPORTANT:
[/u]Currently only supports .pak mods inside .zip files, and "FOMOD" style installer-script-based mods, with .pak files.
[i]
IF YOUR MOD HAS MULTIPLE "FLAVOURS" [/i] - Please make sure you use the FOMOD style installer mentioned above! Otherwise, Vortex will simply dump all of the .pak files into the users Paks folder.

IF YOUR MOD IS COOKED - Please considering using the .pak community standard! This will simplify things for both the end users, and other modders. Or simply hope that I can manage to add support for Cooked mods, or a tool to make them into .pak files in the tool-buttons.
