description.short: Extension that allows mods published on the Bayonetta nexus page to be downloaded through Vortex (currently most mods needs to be updated or Vortex wont be able to recognize them properly or at all).
description.long:
[center][color=#b6b6b6]For the time being, this extension is still a work in progress[/color][/center]

[color=#ffff00][size=4][center][i] [u]How to install and set up everything for modding[/u][/i][/center][/size][/color]
[color=#f1c232][color=#fff2cc][size=4]Once the extension is installed immediately do this to avoid any issue [/size][/color][/color]
[color=#f6b26b]Go to settings[/color], then the[color=#f6b26b] MODS tab[/color] and it should look like this, place the Mod Staging Folder (where mods will be located) in the same drive where Bayonetta is located (I recommend to install bayonetta in another drive instead of the main Drive to avoid issues like crashing if it is open through steam)
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/YqZFZww8/3254.png[/img][center]
[color=#ffff00][size=4]You are ready to start modding.[/size][/color][/center][color=#ffff00][size=4]
 [/size][/color]
[size=3][color=#ff7700][center]﻿[/center][color=#f6b26b][size=3]In case of conflicts like this, where two mods have the same files, use only ONE MOD, never both at the same time. (Currently working on this issue)[/size][/color]
[/color][/size][color=#ffff00]1.[/color]
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/wvYpxnj5/conflicts.png[/img]
[color=#ffff00]2. [color=#fff2cc](Hopefully the next update will prevent users of using this method of resolving conflicts, since Bayonetta is not a bethesda game duh, there's no load order just one file (or multiple) per costume)[/color][/color]
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/pTWRqyG7/conflicts.png[/img]
[color=#00ffff][size=4]Mods working with the vortex extension are :[/size][/color]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/23?tab=files]Bayonetta Music Mod (completely)
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/32]Custom Bayonetta 2 Themed UI and minor edits (not completely, it seems its an issue with the extension not recognizing subfolders, currently working on it)
[/url][color=#fce5cd]
[/color][size=3][center][color=#ffff00][size=5][u][i][color=#fce5cd]Section only for modders [/color][/i][/u][/size][/color][/center][/size][color=#ffff00]READ THE [i][u]INDIVIDUAL COSTUMES[/u][/i] section (even if you are not a modder) because almost all mods from the Bayonetta nexus page need to be updated with a specific structure or else the mods won't work (you will need to manually extract and put the folders into a zip, 7zip or rar file if you want the mod to even work)[/color]
[size=3]

[i]If you want to create your own fomod for Bayonetta[/i][/size]
 
Follow this guide [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/How_to_create_mod_installers]How to create mod installers[/url]

Here's an example of how I made the structure of the [color=#ffff00][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/6821/?tab=files]FOMOD[/url][/color](this is the tool) base on this [color=#f4f4f4][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/35]two[/url][/color] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/mods/34?tab=files]mods[/url] from [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/users/93473883]creativehandler[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/bayonetta/users/100080168]cookieman301[/url]:[url=https://postimg.cc/gallery/kRnPXQk] [color=#ffff00][size=4][size=3]https://postimg.cc/gallery/kRnPXQk [/size]
[/size][/color][/url][color=#cfe2f3][color=#f6b26b][size=3]If you want to open a FOMOD, open the tool and go to the dropdown menu and click on the FOMOD menu or tab (?) and open folder, select in this case A Witch With No Memories and The Famed Witch (+Extras) and it should give you an example on how to set a your own FOMOD[/size][/color]
[color=#ffe599][color=#00ffff]Note[/color]: If a [color=#00ffff]group (main folder-example-)[/color] contains more than three [color=#00ffff]plugins (subfolders[color=#cfe2f3][color=#ffe599][color=#00ffff]-example-[/color][/color][/color])[/color] set priorities from 1, 2, 3 and 4 and so on until you reach the last plugin or the first plugin wont be recognized by Vortex regardless of the "Selection" options you put[/color][/color]

-Once opened the tool, go the info tag and read the instructions to know what
does what (also be careful to not use some symbols and other stuff like
ñ or ´ when naming the folders or files, if you are familiar with
coding or programing you know what I mean)

-Don't bother with Flag Set, Conditions, Plugin Dependencies, Required Installation or
Conditional installations UNLESS ABSOLUTLY necessary, for example if you
have manage to create a new way to mod Bayonetta then yes (exaggerating
but you get the idea), by all means (which will force me to update the extension and yeah...)

[center][size=4][i][u][color=#ffff00]Individual costumes[/color][/u][/i]
[/size][/center]
[color=#00ff00]For example in case you are only replacing one costume with no variations, the folder structure has to ALWAYS[color=#b6d7a8] (for now, until I discover a way to make the extension place the files in the proper folder regardless of the mod structure)[/color] be like this [color=#b6d7a8](yes, inside the 7z file can go the wp, se, et, id or any other folder as long as it follows the structure below[/color][/color])
[img]https://i.postimg.cc/c4y4GB4G/Proper-Folder-Structure.png[/img]

Some resources for modders (is not mine)

[url=https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1G_nSHwJez5N2w1aCI7mwiV6IF1DMP76FmSQKqjSKz3A/edit#gid=165438385]https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1G_nSHwJez5N2w1aCI7mwiV6IF1DMP76FmSQKqjSKz3A/edit#gid=165438385
[/url][url=https://discord.com/invite/P6FdwFK]


[/url]
Changes to be made:

[list]
[*]Make the extension recognizce subfolders inside the mods
[*]If two mods contains the same files, make the user choose only one, not both.
[*]Make the extension recognize file names and put them inside their respective folders without the need of a folder structure
[/list]

description.short:
This is an extension addon to use Vortex with The Riftbreaker Prologue.
Subject to Change as the game is still in Development.
Please Report issues I will fix it only, IF something is reported as I don't use this or constantly check this Extension so please Report ANYTHING you want changed or fixed. Thanks
description.long:
This is an extension addon to use Vortex with The Riftbreaker Prologue by EXORStudios.
Allows for easy management of mods and installation for The Riftbreaker.
﻿Makes sure that the mod is in the correct format and that they are placed into the correct folder to be used

Download the extension game support to Vortex, then [b]MANUALLY[/b] download the config and extract into the game folder (i.e. The Riftbreaker Prologue) and say [b]YES TO ALL[/b] to be able to play mods at all. 

Remember to have The Riftbreaker Prologue off Steam not the Demo one as this is the current and updated one.
Also, there is no Version checking yet so MAKE sure that the mode you download is for the correct game version that you have.

Additional Mods can be found at https://discord.gg/qkQDY3A3


[b]
MOD AUTHORS[/b]

Remember that all mods must have a .zip file archive inside the mod file name archive. 
An example is "'mymodname'.zip/'abreviatemod'_win_data.zip/'game files'"
In other words, it must be a double zip.
An actual example of how to properly pack the mods is on this page alongside the extension

As this game is an open source you can mod almost every little aspect there is, and the modded files should be first copied from the "00_win_data.zip" 
and placed into the "mod_win_data.zip" archive just as the original game files are.
You DO NOT need every file from the original game files just add what is changed from your modded files and it will overwrite the original game files.

description.short: Vortex support for the EasyNPC overhauling tool for Skyrim Special Edition. Provides mod information to the tool so that face previews and build checks work correctly.
description.long:
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/52313][code]﻿[/code]EasyNPC [/url]is a tool for managing multiple (dozens, hundreds) sets of NPC overhauls in Skyrim Special Edition. It was primarily designed for Mod Organizer, but can be made to work equally well with Vortex using this extension.

To use this extension:

[list=1]
[*]Download and [url=https://github.com/focustense/easymod/wiki/EasyNPC-%E2%80%90-Home#installation]install EasyNPC[/url]﻿﻿, but do not run it yet.
[*]Add EasyNPC.exe as an external tool in Vortex (Dashboard → "Add Tool", using the correct [url=https://github.com/focustense/easymod/wiki/easynpc-%E2%80%90-command%E2%80%90line-arguments]command-line arguments[/url]﻿; you can leave everything else as default after choosing the target)
[*]Add this extension to Vortex.
[/list]
Once installed, you will see a "Launch EasyNPC" button in the mod toolbar when you manage SSE:

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/265/265-1625854658-647310336.png[/img]

Make sure you [b]always[/b] use this button to launch the app. If you try to launch it directly from the Vortex dashboard instead, you'll see a warning, and some features will not work correctly if you ignore the warning.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Technical details: [/b]Because of how Vortex organizes its staging directory, by creating one subdirectory per [i]file[/i] (rather than per [i]mod[/i], like Mod Organizer), EasyNPC requires additional information to understand the relationship between "mods" and "mod files". Launching EasyNPC with this extension ensures that it always has the most up-to-date information, so that face previews show up correctly, build checks don't report incorrect errors, and everything runs smoothly in general.

description.short: Small update to the official Stardew Valley extension that enables support for the 64-bit version of the game
description.long:
Small update to the official Stardew Valley Vortex extension that enables support for the 64-bit version of the game.

Learn how to install SDV64 of the game here:
https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Modding:Migrate_to_64-bit_on_Windows

If you run into problems with SDV64 after upgrading to this version of the Vortex extension, try removing SMAPI from your Vortex profile, uninstalling SMAPI from SDV64 (just run the SMAPI installer and tell it the directory where you have SDV64 installed), then manually reinstalling SMAPI for SDV64.

description.short: Vortex extension that allows you to hide or delete files from other mods based on a configuration kept in your modlist.
description.long:
[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Description[/size][/color]

Broom is a Vortex extension that allows you to automatically hide or delete files from your mods. To achieve this, Broom reads a configuration file that is also installed as a mod in your list. In the config file you can specify a set of rules (file names, patterns etc.) that Broom then uses to hide/delete mod files.

The idea is simple but it allows you to:

[list]
[*]resolve mod conflicts in a more automated way, allowing you to move the mods in the list independent of each other
[*]combine mods by hiding conflicting files and sharing the config without having to share the original assets
[*]keep track of file operations that had to be done manually before
[*]remove various files from a mod and share these changes without the need to share the original mod
[*]save some disk space but cleaning up unnecessary files, while keeping track of the changes at the same time
[/list]
[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Installation[/size][/color]

Install automatically with Vortex by going to the Extensions section, Find More, search for Broom.
You can also manually install by downloading the main file and dropping into the Extensions section in Vortex.

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Configuration Files[/size][/color]

Before using Broom, you need to create a configuration file telling it what files it should hide/delete.

A sample file has been provided in the Optional Files section. This can be installed as a mod directly with Vortex.

To make you own, simply create a file having the [b].broom[/b] extension, archive it and drag the archive into Vortex.

The configuration files should contain a list of [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glob_%28programming%29]glob patterns[/url] matching the files you want to get rid of.
Example:

[code]riftenplazabrick01*
*.png
[/code]

The first rule matches all files containing riftenplazabrick01 (like riftenplazabrick01.dds and riftenplazabrick01_n.dds) while the second one matches all files with the png extension.

Additionally, you can negate patterns by prefixing rules with a "!". Any matching files included by previous rules will now be excluded:

[code]Rugnarok\meshes\**\*.nif
!Rugnarok\meshes\**\rug01.nif[/code]

The above will match all meshes inside the Rugnarok mod, except rug01.nif

You can also specify comments by using a "#" at the beginning of the line:

[code]# this is a comment describing my awesome rule
SKSE\**\*.pdb[/code]

You can of course have multiple config files and enable/disable them in you modlist as you wish.

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Usage[/size][/color]

To launch Broom, go to MODS and press the Broom icon in the toolbar.

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/270/270-1627332717-2063362335.png[/img]

Press the Find Files button and wait for it to scan your modlist. Review the matching files and press the Hide Files button.

All the matching files will be renamed with the [b].vohidden [/b]extension, preventing them to be loaded by the game.

Make sure to Deploy Mods after running Broom so that renamed files are properly managed by Vortex.

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/270/270-1627332694-2058952433.png[/img]

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Settings[/size][/color]

Access the extension settings by navigating to:  Settings -> Interface -> Broom

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Un-hiding files[/size][/color]

Broom's hide operations are [color=#6aa84f][b]fully reversible[/b][/color] meaning that you can restore the files previously hidden.
All you have to do is enable the option in the settings and rerun the tool. The same configuration file is used for both hiding an un-hiding.

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Deleting Files[/size][/color]

If you're really low on disk space you can choose to delete files instead of hiding them. Files are permanently deleted so if you want to restore them you need to reinstall the respective mods.

[color=#f6b26b][size=5]Source Code[/size][/color]

The [url=https://github.com/mihaifm/broom]source code[/url] for the plugin is available on Github under the MIT license. An MO2 version has also been uploaded [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/52097]here[/url].
This was a fun experiment writing the same plugin for both Vortex and MO2.

[size=4]**Enjoy!**[/size]

description.short: Vortex extension to add modding support for: She Will Punish Them.
description.long:
[size=3]Adds Vortex support for the game: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem]She Will Punish Them[/url].

Will Download and auto-install the most current version of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/115]BepInEx from Nexus[/url].

[b]User must load/start the game once all the way into the menus and then close the game out to desktop to finish installation, then restart Vortex.


[/b]
If you want to download and install [url=http://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx/releases]BepInEx from GitHub[/url] manually,  [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem/articles/1]Detailed instructions on installing BepInEx are here.[/url] provided by user, mod creator: [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem/users/18901754]aedenthorn[/url].
Don't forget to endorse and/or give kudos for his work and time put in the install instructions.


[size=4][b]Installation Simple method:[/b][/size]

1- Open Vortex Select "Games" tab and activate the game.

2- Vortex will download BepInEx from here on Nexus then:

     a. If you already have BepInEx installed you are done! just go install mods as usual and enjoy the game.

     b. If you do not have it, once Vortex is done installing It will restart[b]***[/b] once loaded you  now find a mod named:
         "[b]Bepis Injector Extensible[/b]" under Vortex's "[b]MODS[/b]" tab, [size=3][b]ENABLE[/b] IT [/size]and [b]DEPLOY[/b] as usual.
          Close Vortex, Now this is [b]IMPORTANT:[/b]
          [b]load[/b] the[b] game once[/b] all the way in to game then close the game, restart Vortex.
          Repeat step 1 then install your mods, deploy and enjoy your game.


[b]***[/b] If you get a Game mode error or still does not work read NOTE further down below.



[size=4]
[b]Installation Detailed method:[/b][/size]


If Manual install:
                Click on this great [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem/articles/1]very detailed tutorial[/url] by modder [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem/users/18901754]aedenthorn[/url]. Don't forget to endorse him!

Or Follow my version here:

   Download lastest build of [url=http://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx/releases]BepInEx[/url] extract that folder content to the game folder ( same place as the She Will Punish Them.exe  )
                a.Run the game once and it will make some extra folders.  [b]*(See note below)[/b]
                b.Now go back to the game folder and inside the BepInEx folder there are some new folders you want "plugins" folder.
                c.Download a mod and extract the dll file and folder if it has one in to the "plugins" folder and you are done
                d.Play the game.



Auto with Vortex mod manager:

   The extension for SWPT on this page is preloaded with Vortex:
                a.Open Vortex,go to the games tab and activate/manage SWPT, follow the instructions, if done right you should now have a new tab called "MODS" click on it.
                d.You should already have 1 mod in MODS tab called "Bepis Injector Extensible"  Enable it if is not already and Deploy, let Vortex do it's thing.
                e.1.Now here on nexus go to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/shewillpunishthem]SWPT[/url] mod page pick, your mod and just click on the button for downloads that says "Vortex" it will download direct into Vortex.
                e.2 .If the Mod only has Manual Download, Make a folder to save such mods and once downloaded drag into Vortex "Drop File" bottom section or click "Install from File" and go to where you saved the mod.
                f.Now click on "Never Installed" it will install, then it will say "disable"  click on it, now will make it "enable", then Deploy.
                g.Now launch and play.



 Info for newbies like me if you want to read and learn:

The first part of Vortex installation( the Ext ) is the get Vortex to manage the game,
BepInEx is what we need to run the mods for Unity.
It  is only a 1 time set up, you do not have to do it again, then is just click a Mod you want, enable and play.
Also good about the Vortex method is, if you ever need to clean the folder, with "Purge" Cleans out you mods and it leaves only the original files in the event you need to verify integrity or what not and then you can Re-deploy all or some if needed  .

Hope that helps.

[size=5][b]***NOTE:[/b][/size] [b]*IMPORTANT*[/b]   Both Methods after BepInEx gets installed you need to -->[b]RUN THE GAME ONCE[/b]<--, and then close it so BepInEx can create the extra folders it needs.
   

[/size]
[size=2]
[/size][size=4][size=2][b][size=4]Credits:[/size][/b]
[size=3]Can not thank [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/users/31179975?tab=about+me]Pickysaurus[/url] enough, not only by helping me personally with this but also by sharing all the information he does to make this and other mods possible!!
So again THANK YOU!

Please go give him kudos and support his creations!

Also thanks to the BepInEx Dev team: Bepis ([url=http://www.nexusmods.com/users/65815626?tab=about+me]bbepis[/url]) , DeathWeasel1337, js6pak and
ManlyMarco, without them and their work this would not be possible at all.


[size=2][size=4]Source code for BepInEX[/size]
[url=https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx]https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx[/url]
[/size][/size][/size][/size]

description.short: An INI editor for Vortex.
description.long:
An INI editor built into the Mods section of Vortex. This is a little project I have been playing with for a while but I don't plan to work on anymore. If you'd like to fork the project and continue it, just let me know and I'll add you as the owner of this page. 

[size=4]For users
[/size]In the Mods tab, a new icon will appear for Skyrim SE and Fallout 4 called "INI Editor", this will open a new dialog box which allows you to edit INI files and define custom files to edit the same way. 

[size=4]For developers
[/size]If you are creating a game extension and would like to have certain INIs (or other text files) to be identified by this tool, simply add a "iniFiles" property to the game object inside "registerGame". It must be a synchronous function that takes a single parameter, which will be the state.

description.short: Adds mod management for Siege Survival: Gloria Victis to Vortex.
description.long:
This extension adds Siege Survival: Gloria Victis as a game supported in Vortex for mod management.

Note: Currently Vortex creates marker files in all mod directories. This is because Siege mods contain empty folders (and will crash without them), but Vortex ignores empty folders when deploying your mods. 


[b]Vortex Install (Easy)[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Siege Survival: Gloria Victis in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list]
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

Manual Install

Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\Siege Survival

description.short: Mod management support for Star Traders: Frontiers in Vortex.
description.long:
This extension adds Star Traders: Frontiers as a game supported in Vortex for mod management. The extension can currently install any mod that features a manifest.json file. Mods without that file will not install correctly. Starting the game via Vortex will, by default, start the modding friendly version of the game. A handy shortcut to the mod-free version of the game will also be added to the dashboard. 


[b]Vortex Install (Easy)[/b]

[*]In Vortex, locate Star Traders: Frontiers in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install[/b]

Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\Star Traders: Frontiers

description.short: Handle nexusmods.com downloads for different games with different mod managers.
description.long:
[b]What?
[/b]
Usually the "Download with Manager" links on nexusmods.com will always open the same mod manager, this is a technical limitation of how browsers/windows handle network protocols.

This extension includes a little tool, configurable through Vortex, that will handle the download links instead of mod managers and then forward the download to the mod manager assigned for a specific game.

tl;dr: With this you can have Skyrim mods download to Vortex and New Vegas mods to Mod Organizer for example.

Gimmick: Using this Vortex will actually react a little quicker when starting a download.

[b]How?[/b]

In Vortex go to Extensions -> Find More, look for NXM Proxy, install.
Vortex will prompt for you to restart it, after you did go to Settings -> NXM Proxy.
Enable the Proxy, then add any mod manager you want to handle downloads, then assign the games you want to use with each.

[b]Other Mod Managers[/b]

The nxmproxy tool is a single ~400kb exe without any further dependencies. It's released under the GPL at https://github.com/TanninOne/nxmproxy and configurable through a command line or a configuration file.
You are welcome to include or integrate it with any other mod manager.

description.short: This extension adds support for Bloons TD6.
description.long:
This extension adds support for Bloons TD6.

It will also warn the user if MelonLoader is not installed and redirect them to the download page.

description.short: Adds game support for Hardspace: Shipbreaker to Vortex.
description.long:
This is my first attempt at an extension and I'm expecting it to need a bit of tweaking for stability. Please let me know if you have any issues with it!

Source code: https://github.com/themagickoala/vortex-extension-hardspace-shipbreaker

description.short: Add My Summer Car support into Vortex.
description.long:
This extension adds support to manage My Summer Car mods.

You'll need to install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/mysummercar/mods/147]MSCLoader[/url] into your game directory first, but after that you can manage all mods through Vortex.

Save games and car skins are not currently supported.

description.short: Adds Vortex game support for Diablo II Resurrected
description.long:
Lets keep this brief - this game extension only supports MPQ mods (no loose files).

Only one MPQ mod can be active at any time (That's just how the game works) - you can select which one by right clicking the mod you want to activate in the mods page and select "D2R Make Active". Vortex has an experimental mods merging functionality - you can extract MPQ mods during their installation which will make them mergeable; simply install a mod with an MPQ file and Vortex will query you.

Merging mods can get complex depending on the mods you have installed - you may have to edit the files yourself to fix a conflict.

[b]Please make sure that the MPQ mod you're trying to set as active is enabled and deployed (this goes for the merged vortex mod too)[/b]

The game extension comes with the following tools included to assist you in your modding:
D2 Excel
Ladiks Casc Viewer
MPQ Editor

The tools will get installed when you first manage your game.

Installation:
Wait for the game tile to appear in the Games page and click on it once it does (might take a couple of minutes for the extensions list to update)

Enjoy and let me know if you encounter any issues with it.

description.short: Adds support for The Riftbreaker to Vortex
description.long:
This extension adds support for The Riftbreaker to Vortex.

[b][color=#ff0000]NOTE: WHEN UPDATING FROM 0.0.1 or 0.0.2[/color]

[/b]In the initial versions of this extension, mod files were deployed as zip files to the "Packs" folder. From version 0.0.3 onwards, mods are deployed as individual files to the "Data" folder. This change allows Vortex to fully handle the deployment process and has benefits like detecting conflicting files between mods.

However, this switch may cause users upgrading from version 0.0.1 or 0.0.2 to end up with old mod files leftover in their "Packs" folder. If you originally used one of these versions, please check mods have been fully removed from your "Packs" folder after uninstalling a mod.
[b]
Installation[/b]

[list]
[*]In Vortex, open the Games tab and locate The Riftbreaker.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]
[b]Mod Authors[/b]

Package your files in a zip file as you normally would. Upon installation, the zip file will be copied to the games `Packs` folder.

[b]Credits[/b]

Thank you to Pickysaurus and their Farming Simulator 19 Support plugin, which I used as an example upon which to base this extension.

[b]Source[/b]

[url=https://github.com/Karillion/game-theriftbreaker]https://github.com/Karillion/game-theriftbreaker[/url]

description.short: This changes the Vortex theme to look like a Pip-Boy screen of the Amber variety, like in Fallout: New Vegas.
description.long:
There's not a whole lot of themes, so I thought I'd mess around with CSS for a [s]bit[/s] (2.0.0 update: lot longer :D) to get Vortex looking like my favorite game to mess around with mods in.

Let me know if anything needs updating or if you have an idea for a theme, and endorse if you like it!﻿
﻿
[img]https://i.ibb.co/yVxbdd9/Vortex-Special-Orange.png[/img]
[font=Tahoma][size=4][b][u]
More Colors
[/u][/b][/size][/font]﻿
[b]Fallout [/b]﻿(V 2.0)
[color=#efefef][[/color][color=#00ff00]Green Edition[/color][color=#f4f4f4]] a[/color]vailable [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/327]here[/url]﻿.
[[color=#00ffff]Blue Edition[/color]] [color=#f4f4f4]a[/color]vailable [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/441/]here[/url].
[color=#efefef][[/color]White Edition[color=#f4f4f4]] a[/color]vailable [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/477]here[/url]﻿﻿.

[b]Elder Scrolls [/b]﻿(V 3.0)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/541]Skyrim - Night Sky[/url]

[b][font=Tahoma][size=4][u]Setup
[/u][/size][/font][/b]
[color=#ff7700]To install[/color]:
Method 1: Use the Vortex button, and install (From "Downloads" if no popup), restart Vortex.
Method 2: Alternatively manually download and drop the zipped file where it says to in Vortex Extensions tab.

If neither work make sure these are up-to-date:
Vortex - 'Settings > Vortex > Update' should NOT say "No automatic updates".
Browse Extensions list - Press the refresh button on the bottom before installing.

[color=#ff7700]Activate in Vortex by going to[/color]:﻿
[code]Settings > Theme > Theme Dropdown > PipBoy Theme
[/code]

[b][font=Tahoma][size=4][u]FAQ[/u][/size][/font][/b]

[color=#ff7700]Why am I not seeing Vault Boy?![/color]:﻿
He hides when you're offline! Wait how did you get to this page while having that issue?

[color=#ff7700]Can I disable the "Get more mods" button[/color]?
Yes! Use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/352]Remove Get More Mods Button[/url] by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/users/16367674]Glaceon575[/url].

[color=#ff7700]Can you use a more reactive web-like cursor?[/color]
With [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/359]Theme Snippets[/url] you can, and it also can disable the "Get more mods" button, but you'll have to disable the custom cursor.﻿

[b][font=Tahoma][size=4][u]Customization[/u][/size][/font][/b]

[color=#ff7700]Is there something you'd like just slightly different? Well your eyes have travelled to just the right spot![/color]
Thanks to my new and improved combo of custom files[color=#ffff00] [/color]you can do exactly that!

Just use these with ease:
[color=#ff7700]customChanges.scss[/color] - Enable disable or edit features
[color=#ff7700]myVariables.scss [/color]- Swap an image or font
Or for more in-depth customization:
[color=#ff7700]style.scss[/color]

What you can change:
[list]
[*]Special [font=Monofonto]Font[/font] used for some sections.
[*]Custom cursor.
[*]Image on the top bar - comes with a rad alternative vault-tec icon!
[*]Images for the hovered/un-hovered side bar.
[*]The background scanline animation. (more on that below)
[*]Enable a border around buttons. (Try it and see if you like it)
[/list]
[color=#ff7700]To change any image:[/color]
Replace the image URL with your own custom image using a [url=https://www.base64-image.de/]Base 64[/url], regular image link, or full file path.

[color=#ff7700]To remove or change speed of the animated scanline:[/color]
Ctrl+F for "animation:wave 1s infinite ease-in-out;" and comment it out by adding a '//' at the beginning of the line, or change '1s' to whatever speed you like.
(s = seconds)

[color=#ff7700]How to comment or uncomment:[/color]
// <-- This comments a line when at the front of it, you can delete that to uncomment it too.
/* <-- This is for when you want to comment out a whole section (Better then leaving brackets empty) --> */

description.short: Adds support for installing and managing Horizon Zero Dawn mods with Vortex.
description.long:
[size=4]Horizon Zero Dawn support for Vortex[/size]

This extension adds support for Horizon Zero Dawn mods to the Vortex mod manager.

[quote]This extension is still in preview, please report any issues you find![/quote]

[size=4]What is it?[/size]

This is a simple Vortex extension that adds support for Horizon Zero Dawn mods so that you can install game mods using the Vortex mod manager.

Using Vortex you can install, manage, track and uninstall mods for Horizon Zero Dawn just like you install mods for any of your other Vortex-supported games.

[size=4]How to use it?[/size]

You should be able to immediately install the extension by finding Horizon Zero Dawn in your Vortex Games list and clicking Manage. 
Otherwise, install it directly from the Extensions pane, by clicking Find More and searching for "Horizon Zero Dawn".

[i]Please report any bugs or issues you find as I have only been able to complete some basic (and limited) testing with this extension.[/i]

---

Disclaimer: This project is not associated with Nexus Mods, nor with Sony Interactive Entertainment or Guerrilla Games.

description.short: A Vortex extension adding support for Bugsnax
description.long:
This is an extension that adds support for Bugsnax to Vortex.

Bugsnax modding works by primarily reading .zip files in the game's root directory, as well as replacing files within the folders in the root directory. This tool makes use of Vortex's features by allowing the easy management of mods by automatically managing files on install, and uninstall. Providing that mods are made correctly, files will be automatically put in the right place with other files being backed up.

If there are any questions, concerns, or problems, please feel free to comment, message me, or contact me through some other form.

[u][b]NOTE:

[/b][/u]Game location should be autodected for Steam, Epic Games, and Windows Store/Xbox Launcher. However, there may be circumstances where it fails to detect the location of game files for Windows Store/Xbox Launcher. In these circumstances, you will need to manually set this.

extensions.author: SlyAceZeta

description.short: This Vortex extension adds mod management and load order support for Battle for Bikini Bottom Rehydrated.
description.long:
This [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] extension adds mod management and load order support for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/spongebobsquarepantsbattleforbikinibottomrehydrated]SpongeBob SquarePants: Battle for Bikini Bottom - Rehydrated[/url]. This extension is based on and uses Pickysaurus' [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/153]Unreal Engine Mod Installer[/url]﻿.

[size=4]Installation[/size]

In Vortex, simply go to the Games section, find the Battle for Bikini Bottom Rehydrated tile, click on "Manage", and follow the prompts to install the extension and restart Vortex. If a prompt appears to install the Unreal Engine Mod Installer, click "Fix" in the prompt and restart Vortex once more.

You can also enable advanced mode in Vortex's settings, download the ZIP archive from the Files tab above, and drop the archive into Vortex's Extensions section. You can even do it more manually by extracting the ZIP archive to a custom subfolder in Vortex's plugins folder (likely %APPDATA%\Vortex\plugins).

If you don't have SALT installed it will warn you. You need to install SALT manually. To do this just run the exe file that you get off of nexus mods.

description.short: Adds Vortex game support for Dying Light 2
description.long:
This extension adds Dying Light 2 as a game supported in Vortex. Current the extension only supports mods with PAK files, these are merged together depending on the filename of the mod file. E.g. Mod 1 with data2.pak and mod 2 with data2.pak will get merged into a single data2.pak file which is deployed to the game's directory. If an additional mod exists with a different .pak filename (i.e. data3.pak) - Vortex will deploy data2.pak as a merged mod, and data3.pak separately.

Vortex Install (Easy) - if the extension does not appear in the games page - refresh your extensions list (might take a little while for the update to show up)

[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Dying Light 2 in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

Vortex Install (Advanced) (NOT RECOMMENDED)

[list]
[*]In Vortex, enabled advanced mode in the settings.
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

Manual Install (NOT RECOMMENDED)

Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins.

description.short: Vortex extension for the VR game 'Into the Radius'
description.long:
[b]Vortex Extension for the VR game 'Into the Radius'[/b]


The extension uses [b]''[/b][b]steamapps\common\IntoTheRadius\IntoTheRadius\Content\Paks\''[/b] as the [u]root [/u]install folder.  [u]Mods are installed directly into the \Paks\ folder.
[/u]
Most existing mods on the Nexus ITR site should be compatible, mod authors just need to turn on the 'Download with Vortex' button (some mods still need to be repackaged as they contain several file options for the user to choose from)


Goto [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/intotheradiusvr]Into the Radius - NexusMods[/url] for ITR mods.


CHANGELOG
[list]
[*]Version 0.0.2[list]
[*]Revision to Index.js -- 'prepareForModding' function (see comments section). Also updated Info.json. Reuploaded 0.0.2 as the first upload wasn't showing file preview
[/list]
[*]Version 0.0.1[list]
[*]Initial release. BASIC ITR support. Tested with the STEAMVR version, may not work with the Oculus Store version of the game.
[/list]
[/list]

[b][u][color=#ffff00]**Oculus Store version**[/color][/u][/b]
- owners of the Oculus store version (I own both STEAM and Oculus), you must set the game location manually
- go into your Oculus software install directory, find[b][i] 'creative-mobile-games-project-radius'[/i][/b] folder (this is ITR). That's it
- See pics

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/348/348-1693195882-1308962911.png[/img]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/348/348-1693195126-859815464.png[/img]




Credits:
- Nexus for Vortex and the wiki guide on how to create a game extension. Link to wiki used: [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/Creating_a_game_extension_for_Vortex]Creating a game extension for Vortex - Nexus Mods Wiki[/url]
- CM Games for their awesome game 'Into the Radius' - store link: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1012790/Into_the_Radius_VR/]Into the Radius VR on Steam (steampowered.com)[/url]

description.short: Vortex extension to add modding support for: Mon Bazou
description.long:
[size=3]This adds Vortex support for the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/monbazou]Mon Bazou[/url] game.[/size]

[size=3]Will Download and auto-install the most current version of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/115]BepInEx from Nexus[/url].

[size=3][size=4][b]Installation:[/b][/size]

1- Open Vortex Select "Games" tab and activate the game.

2- Vortex will download BepInEx from here on Nexus then:

     a. If you already have BepInEx installed you are done! just go install mods as usual and enjoy the game.

     b. If you do not have it, once Vortex is done installing It will restart[b]***[/b] once loaded you  now find a mod named:
         "[b]Bepis Injector Extensible[/b]" under Vortex's "[b]MODS[/b]" tab, [size=3][b]ENABLE[/b] IT [/size]and [b]DEPLOY[/b] as usual.
          Close Vortex, Now this is [b]IMPORTANT:[/b]
          Repeat step 1 then install your mods, deploy and enjoy your game.

[size=4][size=2][size=3][size=2][size=4]Source code for BepInEX[/size]
[url=https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx]https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx[/url] [/size][/size][/size][/size]
[/size][/size]

description.short: Offers more customization for vortex themes without requiring css skills.
description.long:
[size=4][b]Theme Snippets[/b][/size]
This is an extension for Vortex. It provides additional customization options for themes without requiring css skills.

[b]Current customizations[/b]
[*]Remove "Get More Mods" overlay buttons
[*]Prevent line-breaks in mods table
[*]Allow mod notes textbox be resized
[*]No mod details pane overlay (is instead shown side-by-side)
[*]Show toolbar buttons without text
[*]No longer gray out undiscovered games
[*]Remove "alpha" badge from Collections tab
[*]web-style mouse cursors
[*]Allow selecting any text

[size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size]
You can find this collection in Vortex under Extensions->Find More

[size=4][b]Contributing[/b][/size]
You are welcome to contribute additional snippets.
To find out how, please visit [url=https://github.com/TanninOne/vortex-theme-snippets]https://github.com/TanninOne/vortex-theme-snippets[/url]

description.short: Adds mod management for The Simpsons: Hit & Run to Vortex
description.long:
I just started playing this classic game and wanted an easy way to add and remove mods, so I wrote this extension. 

This extension adds The Simpsons: Hit & Run as a game supported in Vortex for mod management. The extension can currently install any mod that features an .lmlm file. The extension will also check for the mod loader (which is highly recommended) and the game to be quickly started via the launcher. There is also a shortcut to open the launcher on the dashboard. If the mods did not load with the automatic launch, open the launcher manually and ensure all mods are checked. 


[b]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate The Simpsons: Hit & Run in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list]
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\The Simpsons: Hit & Run

[size=5]
View the map at [url=https://modmapper.com]modmapper.com[/url][/size]

Modmapper is a website that puts every Skyrim mod from Nexus Mods on an interactive map. Every cell in the game engine is displayed as a grid over top satellite images of the Skyrim game world. Each cell is colored from green to red representing the number of mods that edit the cell (red meaning the most number of edits). This heatmap gives the Skyrim modding community a new perspective on what parts of the game world are the most popular for modding and which areas are most neglected.

Clicking on a cell on the map will open a panel showing every mod that edits the cell sorted by most popular mods first.

Each mod in the list is a link, clicking on a mod will show every cell on the map that the mod edits (across all versions of the mod).

You can also search for a mod by name or a cell by x and y coordinates in the search bar at the top.

Drag and drop your Skyrim Data folder onto the page and all of the cell edits across all of the loaded plugins will be highlighted on the map and any cells with multiple plugin edits will be highlighted in red to indicate a possible conflict. This works on plugins not even uploaded to Nexus Mods.

Additionally, you can drag and drop your plugins.txt to sort the plugins and automatically enable them based on your actual load order.

The heatmap, grid lines, and grid labels layers can all be toggled off with the buttons in the upper left corner. So, Modmapper can also serve as a great general purpose map of Skyrim using the high resolution satellite images created by the UESP team.

The Skyrim modding community has already found uses of the map to find conflicts between mods or to find untouched places for new mods.

The map is updated every day to show edits from new mods uploaded or updated on Nexus Mods.

All of the code for the project is open source:

* [url=https://github.com/thallada/vortex-modmapper-integration]vortex-modmapper-integration[/url]: the vortex extension that displays "See on Modmapper" buttons for mods and plugins
* [url=https://github.com/thallada/modmapper]modmapper[/url]: program to automate downloading, extracting, and parsing plugins
* [url=https://github.com/thallada/modmapper-web]modmapper-web[/url]: website code for displaying the cell edits as a heatmap on a mapboxgl map
* [url=https://github.com/thallada/skyrim-cell-dump]skyrim-cell-dump[/url]: library for parsing Skyrim plugin files and extracting CELL data

[b]Credits
[/b]
Thanks to Pickysaurus for creating the initial Vortex extension and helping out with development
Thanks to the UESP team for creating the image tiles for the Skyrim map
Thanks to the Nexus Mods team for creating an easy to use API for downloading mod data

description.short: Adds mod management support for Elegos to Vortex.
description.long:
This extension adds Elegos as a game supported in Vortex for mod management. The extension is able to install mods from any source and will include metadata from the modinfo.json file. The load order page allows you to set the priority of conflicting assets by dragging and dropping mods into a new order. When the extension is first initialised modding will be enabled in the game settings file. 


[b]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Elegos in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list]
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\Elegos

description.short:
This extension adds Farming Simulator 22 as a game supported in Vortex for mod management. This extension can only detect the Steam installation of FS22 and will install mods as ZIP files to the
mods folder (unless they are "double zipped", in which case it will
simply extract the nested ZIP files).
description.long:
This extension adds Farming Simulator 22 as a game supported in Vortex for mod management. This extension can only detect the Steam installation of FS22 and will install mods as ZIP files to the mods folder (unless they are "double zipped", in which case it will simply extract the nested ZIP files).
[b]
Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Farming Simulator 22 in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, and install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Vortex Install [b](Advanced)[/b]
[/b]
[list]
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the .zip archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[*]Navigate to the Games tab.
[*]Find Farming Simulator 22
[*]Click manage
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]Extract the 7z archive to C:\Users\<your Username>\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\plugins.
OR
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\Farming Simulator 22.

[b]How to use
[/b]you should be able to just click the link on the mods downloads page but if that link is not there you just go manual install then drag the mod folder to the drop zone in the mods tab of vortex.

[b]Notes
[/b][list]
[*]This will only work with the steam version and possibly the giants DVD and Digital version all though I have not been able to test them.
[/list][list]
[*]Most of the code is from [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/users/31179975]Pickysaurus[/url] so thanks to them.
[*]If you have the epic games, windows store, DVD or Giants Digital could you look to [url=https://modding.wiki/en/vortex/developer/game-detection]this [/url]﻿site to get the game ID and then send it to me so I can update the extension
[*]You must have run the game at least once for this extension to work.
[/list]

description.short: Adds support for Yakuza 0.
description.long:
This extension adds RyuModManager support to Vortex for Yakuza 0. [url=https://github.com/SutandoTsukai181/vortex_mo2_yakuza_plugins]Source code[/url] can be found here.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/yakuza0]Nexus Mods page for Yakuza 0[/url]

[b][size=3]Requirements[/size]

[/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/yakuza0/mods/524]RyuModManager[/url] (v1.7+) has to be installed to the game directory and ran at least once. The extension will show a notification if this has not been done yet.

[b][size=3]Installing

[/size][/b]Select "Yakuza 0" from the games list in Vortex and download the extension.

If you can't find the game in Vortex yet, then you can download the extension from the files section on this page and extract it to ﻿this path:

[size=3][i]C:\Users\[/i]<your-username>[i]\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\plugins\[i]game-yakuza0[/i][/i][/size]
[i]
[/i]Or this path:

[i][size=3]%appdata%\Vortex\plugins\game-yakuza0[/size][/i]

[size=3][b]Usage

[/b][/size]You can now use the [b]Mod Manager Download [/b]option when downloading mods. All mods that mention [b]RyuModManager [/b](or [b]RMM[/b]) in their description should be compatible with this extension. If a mod does not have that option, then you can still download it manually and drag its file to the mods tab in Vortex.

Vortex will show an error if the mod that was downloaded is not supported/has an invalid format. In that case, you can either install it manually or ask the mod author to reupload the mod with RMM support.

You can even convert an unsupported mod yourself, by following [url=https://github.com/SutandoTsukai181/RyuModManager/wiki/Creating-A-New-Mod]these instructions[/url]. All it requires is some basic understanding of the game's data directory layout (which you can get by reading the instructions). After repackaging the mod, you can install it to Vortex manually by dragging it to the mods tab in Vortex.

RyuModManager has to be run before launching the game whenever you install/enable/disable any mods. By default, this is done automatically. If you want to disable this for some reason and run it manually, you can disable the [i]RebuildMLO [/i]option in YakuzaParless.ini, which is generated by RyuModManager in the game directory.

[b][size=3]Credits[/size][/b]

This extension was mostly based on the tutorial extension from [url=https://modding.wiki/en/vortex/developer/create-a-game-extension]here[/url] and the Subnautica extension, so huge thanks to their authors.

[size=3][b]Support﻿

[/b][/size]Please put any questions you may have in the posts section.

Feel free to join the [url=https://discord.com/invite/yakuzamodding]Yakuza Modding Community[/url] Discord server for more help about using RyuModManager and installing mods.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/yakuza6]Nexus Mods page for Yakuza 6: The Song of Life[/url]

[b][size=3]Requirements[/size]

[/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/yakuza0/mods/524]RyuModManager[/url] (v1.7+) has to be installed to the game directory and ran at least once. The extension will show a notification if this has not been done yet.

[b][size=3]Installing

[/size][/b]Select "Yakuza 6: The Song of Life" from the games list in Vortex and download the extension.

If you can't find the game in Vortex yet, then you can download the extension from the files section on this page and extract it to ﻿this path:

[size=3][i]C:\Users\[/i]<your-username>[i]\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\plugins\[i]game-yakuza6[/i][/i][/size]
[i]
[/i]Or this path:

[i][size=3]%appdata%\Vortex\plugins\game-yakuza6[/size][/i]

[size=3][b]Usage

[/b][/size]You can now use the [b]Mod Manager Download [/b]option when downloading mods. All mods that mention [b]RyuModManager [/b](or [b]RMM[/b]) in their description should be compatible with this extension. If a mod does not have that option, then you can still download it manually and drag its file to the mods tab in Vortex.

Vortex will show an error if the mod that was downloaded is not supported/has an invalid format. In that case, you can either install it manually or ask the mod author to reupload the mod with RMM support.

You can even convert an unsupported mod yourself, by following [url=https://github.com/SutandoTsukai181/RyuModManager/wiki/Creating-A-New-Mod]these instructions[/url]. All it requires is some basic understanding of the game's data directory layout (which you can get by reading the instructions). After repackaging the mod, you can install it to Vortex manually by dragging it to the mods tab in Vortex.

RyuModManager has to be run before launching the game whenever you install/enable/disable any mods. By default, this is done automatically. If you want to disable this for some reason and run it manually, you can disable the [i]RebuildMLO [/i]option in YakuzaParless.ini, which is generated by RyuModManager in the game directory.

[b][size=3]Credits[/size][/b]

This extension was mostly based on the tutorial extension from [url=https://modding.wiki/en/vortex/developer/create-a-game-extension]here[/url] and the Subnautica extension, so huge thanks to their authors.

[size=3][b]Support﻿

[/b][/size]Please put any questions you may have in the posts section.

Feel free to join the [url=https://discord.com/invite/yakuzamodding]Yakuza Modding Community[/url] Discord server for more help about using RyuModManager and installing mods.

description.short: Vortex extension that interacts with Steam's API to query and download files. Can currently be used by users and/or extension developers to trigger a game files verification process that can restore the originals of any damaged/tampered files; Can also download Steam Workshop mods for games that support it.
description.long:
[size=3]Couple of things to note before downloading this extension:
[/size]
- Vortex does NOT save/store your Steam credentials and will not do so in the future, as per guidelines in Steam's T&S.
- Vortex 1.5.x and higher is required.
- Running the file verification process will cause Vortex to run a purge operation, this is done to restore any replacement files and avoid breaking your mods.
- DO NOT install or deploy mods while the file verification process is running as it will most probably end (very) badly.
- Closing Vortex during the file verification process will leave your game in an unknown state. You will have to run it again on startup to ensure the game files are not corrupted.
- Please report any issues you experience with this extension in the bugs tab on this page.

[size=3]How to use:[/size]

[b]Steam Workshop Page:[/b]
[b]A new page has been added to allow users to browse Steam Workshop mods - you will need a Steam Web API key; the extension will inform you where and how to generate one.

The UI is currently fugly - I'm not a front-end developer - will do my best to improve it in the future.

Depending on the game, some mods might generate installation errors as the game extensions themselves are not prepared to deal with Steam Workshop mods. I can currently only confirm it's working as expected with Rimworld and Kenshi. Let me know in the posts area if you've tested any other games (which are bundled with Vortex) and I'll fix the game extensions.

Finally - if anyone knows how to query mod metadata by published file id through the Steam API, please get in touch with me so I can add an API based dependency resolution.[/b]

File Verification:
As a Vortex user - a new button has been added to the toolbar on the mods page, "Verify Files" with the Steam icon. Simply click on it to purge your mods and start the Steam Authentication process - the file verification process will kick off if valid credentials are provided; if any damaged/tampered files are detected, Vortex will allow you to choose which files you wish to restore to their original state.

Why would I use this extension instead of Steam's own file verification system you ask?
- Vortex will allow you to select which files to restore
- Game extensions can make use of this extension's API to automatically detect file corruption and restore the files for you.

As an extension developer - API functionality has been added to allow game extensions to start the Steam game file verification process[code]﻿context.api.ext.steamkitVerifyFileIntegrity(parameters: ISteamKitParameters, gameId: string);

export interface ISteamKitParameters {
  Username?: string;
  Password?: string;
  // Not used, probably never will be.
  RememberPassword?: boolean;
  ManifestOnly?: boolean;
  CellId?: number;

  // Files need to be separated by /r or /n
  FileList?: string;

  // Discovery path
  InstallDirectory?: string;
  VerifyAll?: boolean;
  MaxServers?: number;
  MaxDownloads?: number;
  LoginId?: number;

  // Steam app id
  AppId?: number;

  PubFile?: string;
  UgcId?: string;
  Branch?: string;
  BetaBranchPassword?: string;
  DepotIdList?: number[];
  ManifestIdList?: number[];
}
[/code]
At a minimum you will need to provide the Steam `AppId` and game `InstallDirectory` (discovery path)

An extensive developer's guide will be provided with examples soon-ish.

[size=3]How it works:[/size]

This extension will read your Steam game manifests to ascertain which Steam depots your Steam accounts have access to, including any DLC, to generate a file hash list - it will then query the Steam API to ensure that the hashes it generated match the hashes of the original files; if any mismatches are found, Vortex will inform you of this and allow you to download and restore the original files.

[size=3]Future plans:[/size]

- Steam mods browser/downloader
- Improved API functionality for extension developers

This extension uses SteamKit2 and DepotDownloader to communicate with Steam's API service.

description.short:
This extension provides support for GROUND BRANCH mods to be installed using Vortex.
CHECK DESCRIPTION !!!

See the webpage for further notes: https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/412
description.long:
[size=6]GROUND BRANCH extension for Vortex[/size]

This extension provides support for GROUND BRANCH mods to be installed using Vortex.
It only supports mods that use one of the common layouts.

[size=5]Notes for Users[/size]

You will [b]NEED[/b] to [b]MOVE[/b] the [b]STAGING FOLDER[/b] to the [b]SAME DRIVE[/b] as [b]GROUND BRANCH[/b] in order use [b]ANY MODS[/b].

Activate GROUND BRANCH > Settings > Mods > Staging folder* > Deployment Method*
[list]
[*]*Change Staging folder location so its in the same drive as GROUND BRANCH
[/list][list]
[*]**Set the deployment method to HARDLINK
[/list]
If a mod was installed but is not working in-game
[list]
[*]i.e. patches not showing up in-game
[/list]Then it is likely the mod Folder Directory was not supported and was subsequently installed at:

[code] ﻿*/steamapps/common/Ground Branch/{modfolder}
[/code]
[i]>Note that any mods that are moved will no longer be managable by Vortex. It is recommended to install unsupported mods manually.[/i]

[url=https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/412/412-1680978082-1612773880.png]
[/url]


[size=5]Notes for mod authors
[/size]
Mods need to use one of the common layouts.
For example, if we have:

[code] ﻿*/steamapps/common/Ground Branch/GroundBranch/Content/GroundBranch/Mission/Tanker/TerroristHuntCustom.mis
[/code]
It should be packaged as:

[code]    GroundBranch/Content/GroundBranch/Mission/Tanker/TerroristHuntCustom.mis
[/code]
or:

[code]    Content/GroundBranch/Mission/Tanker/TerroristHunt.mis
[/code]
For compatibility, we also support these layouts.

[list=1]
[*]MyFancyMod/Some/Extra/Directories/GroundBranch/Content/GroundBranch/Mission/Tanker/TerroristHuntCustom.mis
[*]MyFancyMod/Some/Extra/Directories/Content/GroundBranch/Mission/Tanker/TerroristHuntCustom.mis
[/list]
[size=5]Layout for PNG patches[/size]

Mods containing patches should look like this:
[list]
[*]GroundBranch/Content/GroundBranch/Patches/Morale/(Author)Funny.png
[*]Content/GroundBranch/Patches/Morale/(Author)Funny.png
[*]GroundBranch/Content/GroundBranch/Patches/CustomCategory/(Author)Name.png
[*]Content/GroundBranch/Patches/CustomCategory/(Author)Name.png
[/list]
PNG files that are [b]not[/b] stored in one of these layouts will be installed to:

[code]    GroundBranch/Content/GroundBranch/Patches/Various/
[/code]
PNG files that do [b]not[/b] have an (Author) will be installed to:

[code] ﻿*/steamapps/common/Ground Branch/{modfolder}
[/code]

[size=5]Opting out of Vortex[/size]

If you do not want to follow the recommended layouts your mod will [b]not[/b] install properly. In this case please opt out of Vortex:

[list=1]
[*]Go to "Mod details" > "File options (Optional)"
[*]Check the option "Remove the 'Download with manager' button"
[/list]
Alternatively you could provide your own custom installer via the FOMOD XML language.
See [url=https://github.com/Bob-AT/fomod-examples-for-groundbranch]https://github.com/Bob-AT/fomod-examples-for-groundbranch[/url] for an example.
(FOMOD is handled directly by Vortex, not by the GROUND BRANCH extension).


_______________________________________________________________________________
GitHub: [url=https://github.com/Deathripper4133/GroundBranch-extension/]https://github.com/Deathripper4133/GroundBranch-extension/[/url]

description.short: Adds support for MechWarrior Online to Vortex
description.long:
Adds support for MechWarrior Online to Vortex. This beta version does the basics to get the files in the correct place.

[b]A note for MWO mod authors
[/b]Please remember to submit your mods in compressed ZIP/7Zip/etc. format!

Note that each mod should be individually packaged and added, don't put a bunch of them in a single zip file and ask users to pull one out. Instead, add variations as separate files (main files, addons, patches, etc.) or separate mod listings where it makes sense.

If users directly download a PAK file, Vortex attempts to extract its contents, which will [i]not [/i]be loaded by MWO! I am looking into solving this, but compressing the files is a good practice regardless and appears to be standard across Nexus Mods. To clarify, if you have a mod like a sound pack in a PAK file, you need to compress that PAK file using a tool such as 7Zip (using 7Z format preferably) and then submit that compressed file (the 7Z file).

[b]Additional advice[/b]
Since users may like to mix and match sound packs, try to make sure that your packs are organized and divided up into parts that make sense (weapon sounds, physics sounds, music, announcer, etc.). Avoid "all in one" replacement mods if possible. This will allow users more granular control over their mod installs and allow them to better manage conflicts in the future.

description.short: Easily check your download speeds from the Nexus Mods servers.
description.long:
This extension adds a "Speed Test" button to the toolbar in the downloads section which allows you to run an automated test of your download connection to the Nexus Mods CDN servers around the world. 

The following tests are performed automatically:
[list]
[*]Check for commonly misconfigured Vortex settings. 
[*]Retrieve test links from both of the main CDN nodes.
[*]Test download speed using a sample file from the website. 
[*]Test each CDN server to judge which one will give you the best connection.
[*]Perform a TraceRoute operation to identify any stalling points between your PC and the server.
[/list]
After collecting your download results, it will also make some recommendations on how your speed can be improved. For Premium users this may include things like increasing the number of download threads or switching your default server. 

The extension also allows for a convenient way to report download problems and pre-fills a lot of the important information required by the [url=https://help.nexusmods.com/article/92-im-having-download-issues-what-can-i-do]troubleshooting article[/url].

description.short: Adds support for Battlefleet Gothic Armada 2 to Vortex. Additional setup required on the user's end. Please read the description and follow the instructions carefully or else it's likely to lead to mod failure.
description.long:
I noticed there was a mod manager for BFGA2 that took me several hours to get working right, so I decided to look for an easier way. This led to me trying to make an extension it. As such, I present to you (hopefully) a functioning extension for BFGA2 on Vortex.

I've tested it with the Skalgrim mod and one of his submods downloaded from nexus as well as the latest version of Veritatem Imperialis off ModDB and both did work after a fashion so the next steps are likely very important.

First: Please note some mods require you to be in the beta branch of BFGA2, accessed through the betas submenu in the game's properties on steam. I'd recommend doing this first and letting steam finish patching the game, then launching it once, when intent on installing a mod that requires it.

Second: If a mod requires you to do something like run the launch command "-NoEAC" you'll also need to set that in your properties menu for BFGA2 on steam since I told Vortex to launch the game through your store platform. (If you are using a modern computer you will crash regularly. Put this line "cmd /c "set OPENSSL_ia32cap=:~0x20000000 && %command%" -NoEAC" in the launch options.)

Third: Install the extension and restart Vortex, then you'll need to move the 40 Gigabyte "BattlefleetGothic2-WindowsNoEditor.pak" file to the "Stock" folder so it doesn't overwrite your mods. It can be found by right clicking the game in steam, manage, browse local files. From here navigate to the Paks folder (BattlefleetGothic2\Content\Paks) and place "BattlefleetGothic2-WindowsNoEditor.pak" into the "Stock" folder. Move the aforementioned "BattlefleetGothic2-WindowsNoEditor.pak" inside said "Stock" folder.

Once all three of these are done then setup should be complete. You may launch the game through the Steam App or vortex. As long as the mod you're installing contains a "Content" folder the extension should put its files in the right spot. If the mod is packaged as a .pkg file you'll probably need to convert it back to a normal folder and then zip it up as a .zip, .7z, or .rar file. Then you should be able to install from file. 

This is my first extension, done in a day and a half with no coding knowledge. It is likely sloppy, but it does seem to work. Simply turn mods on or off by enabling and disabling them. Submods like Skalgrims will require you to resolve mod conflicts, but on my end vortex seemed to be able to suggest the appropriate load order.

You can restore vanilla gameplay by just deactivating any enabled mods. Reverting to pure vanilla (the state the game was in when steam installed it) would require you to remove the launch option you added, remove yourself from the beta branch, and put the pak file you moved back in its previous location.

Note: I only have bfga2 on steam, I do not own it on any other store so can't guarantee that the above instructions are possible and (if possible) work on other store platforms.

description.short: Adds Stray as a moddable game in Vortex.
description.long:
This extension adds Stray as a game supported in Vortex for mod management. The load order page allows you to set the priority of PAK files by dragging and dropping mods into a new order. Mods installed with this extension will be placed under Hk_project/Content/Paks/~mods and each mod will have its own folder (to enable load ordering). Stray only appears to load PAKs from this folder if the PAK filename ends with "_P", so when installing a mod without this naming convention Vortex will offer to rename the files. You can ignore this prompt on a per-mod basis and will need to reinstall it to see the prompt again. 

Special thanks to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/stray/users/4196370]Narknon[/url] for help with the load ordering information. 


[size=4]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/size]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Stray  in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.

description.short: Elegant, modern, and clean UI redesign for Vortex, inspired by Microsoft's Fluent Design System.
description.long:
[b]Fluent [/b]is a Vortex theme inspired by Microsoft's [url=https://www.microsoft.com/design/fluent/]Fluent Design System[/url].

[i][quote]It is created mainly for personal use so it might not necessary cover all the use cases out there. It is developed with the latest beta version of Vortex, so it is recommended to use the beta version for the best experience.[/quote][/i]


[b][size=3]Installation[/size][/b]

1. Download the theme to Vortex

2. In Vortex, go to [b]Settings > Theme[/b]

3. Set Theme to [b]fluent[/b]


[b][size=3]Frequently Asked Questions[/size][/b]

[i]How can I remove the get more mods button?[/i]

Check out the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/352]Remove Get More Mods Button[/url] by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/users/16367674]Glaceon575[/url]. Note that you will need to re-apply on every Fluent update.
Fluent does not intend to change any default functionality provided by Vortex.

[i]How can I customize the color of the theme?[/i]

Starting from 0.8.0, you can change some of the color under the Theme Color settings in Theme settings. If you need more in-depth customization, you can edit the CSS file manually.

[i]How can I disable rounded corners?[/i]

1. Go into Settings > Theme and press the [b]Edit CSS manually[/b] button at the bottom

2. Find the lines
[code]// CONFIG: Remove the "//" from the line below to disable rounded corners
// --border-radius--s: 0;
[/code]
3. Remove the "//" from the second line

[i]How can I change app name and icon?[/i]

1. Go into Settings > Theme and press the [b]Edit CSS manually[/b] button at the bottom

2. Find the lines
[code]$app-name: "Vortex";
$app-icon: "#{$theme-path}/icons/vortex.svg";
[/code]
3. Change to your desired value. For example:
[code]$app-name: "Mod Organizer 3";
$app-icon: "#{$theme-path}/icons/mo3.svg";
[/code]

description.short: This changes the Vortex theme to look like a Pip-Boy screen of the Light Blue variety, like Nuka-Cola Quantum.
description.long:
There's not a whole lot of themes, so I thought I'd mess around with CSS for a [s]bit[/s] (2.0.0 update: lot longer :D) to get Vortex looking like my favorite game to mess around with mods in.

Let me know if anything needs updating or if you have an idea for a theme, and endorse if you like it!﻿

[img]https://i.ibb.co/CHxWZH9/Vortex-Special-Blue.png[/img]
[font=Tahoma][size=4][b][u]
More Colors
[/u][/b][/size][/font]
[b]Fallout [/b]﻿(V 2.0)
[color=#efefef][[/color][color=#e69138]Amber Edition[/color][color=#efefef]] [/color]available [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/324]here[/url].﻿﻿
[color=#efefef][[/color][color=#00ff00]Green Edition[/color][color=#f4f4f4]] a[/color]vailable [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/327]here[/url]﻿.
[color=#efefef][[/color]White Edition[color=#f4f4f4]] a[/color]vailable [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/477]here[/url]﻿.

[b]Elder Scrolls [/b]﻿(V 3.0)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/541]Skyrim - Night Sky[/url]

[b][font=Tahoma][size=4][u]Setup
[/u][/size][/font][/b]
[color=#ff7700]To install[/color]:
Method 1: Use the Vortex button, and install (From "Downloads" if no popup), restart Vortex.
Method 2: Alternatively manually download and drop the zipped file where it says to in Vortex Extensions tab.

If neither work make sure these are up-to-date:
Vortex - 'Settings > Vortex > Update' should NOT say "No automatic updates".
Browse Extensions list - Press the refresh button on the bottom before installing.

[color=#ff7700]Activate in Vortex by going to[/color]:﻿
[code]Settings > Theme > Theme Dropdown > PipBoy Theme
[/code]

[b][font=Tahoma][size=4][u]FAQ[/u][/size][/font][/b]

[color=#ff7700]Why am I not seeing Vault Boy?![/color]:﻿
He hides when you're offline! Wait how did you get to this page while having that issue?

[color=#ff7700]Can I disable the "Get more mods" button[/color]?
Yes! Use [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/352]Remove Get More Mods Button[/url] by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/users/16367674]Glaceon575[/url].

[color=#ff7700]Can you use a more reactive web-like cursor?[/color]
With [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/359]Theme Snippets[/url] you can, and it also can disable the "Get more mods" button, but you'll have to disable the custom cursor.

[b][font=Tahoma][size=4][u]Customization[/u][/size][/font][/b]

[color=#ff7700]Is there something you'd like just slightly different? Well your eyes have travelled to just the right spot![/color]
Thanks to my new and improved combo of custom files[color=#ffff00] [/color]you can do exactly that!

Just use these with ease:
[color=#ff7700]customChanges.scss[/color] - Enable disable or edit features
[color=#ff7700]myVariables.scss [/color]- Swap an image or font
Or for more in-depth customization:
[color=#ff7700]style.scss[/color]

What you can change:
[list]
[*]Special [font=Monofonto]Font[/font] used for some sections.
[*]Custom cursor.
[*]Image on the top bar - comes with a rad alternative vault-tec icon!
[*]Images for the hovered/un-hovered side bar.
[*]The background scanline animation. (more on that below)
[*]Enable a border around buttons. (Try it and see if you like it)
[/list]
[color=#ff7700]To change any image:[/color]
Replace the image URL with your own custom image using a [url=https://www.base64-image.de/]Base 64[/url], regular image link, or full file path.

[color=#ff7700]To remove or change speed of the animated scanline:[/color]
Ctrl+F for "animation:wave 1s infinite ease-in-out;" and comment it out by adding a '//' at the beginning of the line, or change '1s' to whatever speed you like.
(s = seconds)

[color=#ff7700]How to comment or uncomment:[/color]
// <-- This comments a line when at the front of it, you can delete that to uncomment it too.
/* <-- This is for when you want to comment out a whole section (Better then leaving brackets empty) --> */

extensions.author: Nexus Mods

description.short: Adds Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered and Miles Morales as a supported game in Vortex.
description.long:
This extension adds Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered and Miles Morales as a game supported in Vortex for mod management. The extension will guide you through the installation of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/marvelsspidermanremastered/mods/51]Spider-Man PC Modding Tool[/url] by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/marvelsspidermanremastered/users/4885865]jedijosh920[/url] which is used under the hood to apply and remove mods from the game. 

The installation of ".SMPCMOD" files is achieved by extracting the mod into the Vortex staging folder. This allows Vortex to report conflicts between mods that replace the same assets from the original game. On deployment, Vortex will create a merged mod containing all the chosen assets and applies it using SMPC Tool which updates the TOC file in the asset_archives directory.

To revert to the base game simply uninstall all mods or use the "Purge Mods" button to temporarily remove the mods you have enabled. Deploying again will re-apply any removed mods. 

When installing a mod with multiple ".SMPCMOD" files, Vortex will present a choice to allow you to pick which one you want to use. This is to prevent mods that have an uninstaller version from conflicting with themselves. Uninstallers are not required when using Vortex. 

Finally, Vortex also has a "Load order" page, which lists any mods installed outside of Vortex but into the SMPC Tool Mods folder. You can use this screen to enable/disable different mods, but Vortex will only report conflicts with mods it has installed so we recommend reinstalling any other mods through the app.


[b]Vortex Install (Easy)
[/b]
[list]
[*]In Vortex, locate Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered in the Games tab.
[*]Click on the game tile to manage it, install the extension as prompted.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Vortex Install (Advanced)
[/b]
[list]
[*]Navigate to the Extensions tab.
[*]Drop the 7z archive into the "drop zone" at the bottom of the page.
[*]Click the prompt to restart Vortex.
[/list]

[b]Manual Install
[/b]
Extract the 7z archive to %appdata%\Vortex\plugins\Marvel's Spider-Man Remastered

description.short: Adds support for Judgment.
description.long:
This extension adds RyuModManager support to Vortex for Judgment. [url=https://github.com/SutandoTsukai181/vortex_mo2_yakuza_plugins]Source code[/url] can be found here.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/judgment]Nexus Mods page for Judgment[/url]

[b][size=3]Requirements[/size]

[/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/yakuza0/mods/524]RyuModManager[/url] (v3.0+) has to be installed to the game directory and ran at least once. The extension will show a notification if this has not been done yet.

[b][size=3]Installing

[/size][/b]Select "Judgment" from the games list in Vortex and download the extension.

If you can't find the game in Vortex yet, then you can download the extension from the files section on this page and extract it to ﻿this path:

[size=3][i]C:\Users\[/i]<your-username>[i]\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\plugins\[i]game-judgment[/i][/i][/size]
[i]
[/i]Or this path:

[i][size=3]%appdata%\Vortex\plugins\game-judgment[/size][/i]

[size=3][b]Usage

[/b][/size]You can now use the [b]Mod Manager Download [/b]option when downloading mods. All mods that mention [b]RyuModManager [/b](or [b]RMM[/b]) in their description should be compatible with this extension. If a mod does not have that option, then you can still download it manually and drag its file to the mods tab in Vortex.

Vortex will show an error if the mod that was downloaded is not supported/has an invalid format. In that case, you can either install it manually or ask the mod author to reupload the mod with RMM support.

You can even convert an unsupported mod yourself, by following [url=https://github.com/SutandoTsukai181/RyuModManager/wiki/Creating-A-New-Mod]these instructions[/url]. All it requires is some basic understanding of the game's data directory layout (which you can get by reading the instructions). After repackaging the mod, you can install it to Vortex manually by dragging it to the mods tab in Vortex.

[color=#ff0000][size=4]RyuModManager has to be run before launching the game whenever you install/enable/disable any mods.[/size][/color]

[b][size=3]Credits[/size][/b]

This extension was mostly based on the tutorial extension from [url=https://modding.wiki/en/vortex/developer/create-a-game-extension]here[/url] and the Subnautica extension, so huge thanks to their authors.

[size=3][b]Support﻿

[/b][/size]Please put any questions you may have in the posts section.

Feel free to join the [url=https://discord.com/invite/yakuzamodding]Yakuza Modding Community[/url] Discord server for more help about using RyuModManager and installing mods.
