description.short: Extension that adds unofficial support for S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Anomaly to Vortex.
description.long:
[center][b][font=Verdana]Description[/font][/b][/center]

[font=Comic Sans MS]This extension will add [i][b]"S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Anomaly"[/b][/i] to list of games supported by [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i]. There is no difference what version you using.[/font]

[center][b][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ff7700]Also, be sure to have full folder structure in[font=Georgia]"gamedata/configs"[/font], [font=Comic Sans MS]as game/mod always checks entire folder for files. Even if it any not game/mod related file. As Vortex, will create[/font] [font=Georgia]"__folder_managed_by_vortex" file[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]in folder it creates, you will have infinity loading bug. As i'm mentioned above, game/mod will try to read any file that located in[/font] [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]folder include[/font] [font=Georgia]"__folder_managed_by_vortex"[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]file. (This happens only with[/font] [font=Georgia]"configs"[/font] [font=Comic Sans MS]folder) I will also add fix for this, if you can't do this manually![/font][/color][/font][/b][/center]

[font=Verdana][b][center]How to install[/center][/b][/font]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Require [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] for this extension to work. There is 2 ways to install.
1. In [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] go to [b]"Extensions"[/b], click [b]"Find more"[/b] button, search for this extension.
2. Download manually from site and extract to [b]"C:/UserName/AppData/Roaming/Vortex/plugins"[/b]. Also you need "[b]Show hidden files and folders[/b]" set to on, before install this extension this way.[/font]

[font=Verdana][center][b]How this works[/b][/center][/font]

[font=Comic Sans MS]Similar as [i][b]"Vortex"[/b][/i] supported mods, just add archive of any mod, then install it. Also, first folder in archive must be [b]"gamedata"[/b]([b]"database"[/b] for some mods) not [b]"FolderName/gamedata"[/b][/font].

[font=Verdana][center][b]Additional[/b] [/center][/font]

[font=Comic Sans MS][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/78]"[i][b]S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl"[/b][/i][/url],[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/185] "[i][b]S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky"[/b][/i][/url]  and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/186][i][b]"S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat"[/b][/i][/url]﻿ have it own [i][b]"Vortex" [/b][/i]extension.

[b]You also can drag folders into "Drop File(s)" box, so Vortex will create "7z" archive for you.[/b]

Extension also have [b]FOMOD[/b] support, so if mod do have one, you can just probably drop that archive into [b]Vortex "Drop Files(s)[/b] box. Without repacking entire archive.[/font]

description.short: Provides Vortex support to manage "Tales of Arise". Supported mod types: PAK, USM
description.long:
[quote]This extension is a great tool for gamers who want to customize their gaming experience. It allows them to manage mods for Tales of Arise game. One mod that can be managed with this tool is the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/talesofarise/mods/292]Minimap to Compass HUD[/url]﻿ mod, which hides the content of the minimap for a better immersive experience. This mod is helpful for gamers who want to explore the game world more freely and without the minimap displaying information that can take away from the game's atmosphere. With this Vortex extension support, gamers can easily manage their mods and make sure they are properly installed. It's a great way to customize your gaming experience and make the game more enjoyable.[/quote]

[size=5]Supported mode types:[/size][list]
[*]PAK - E.g. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/talesofarise/mods/188]Rinwell - Traveller from Another World - Mona Costume Replacement[/url]﻿﻿
[*]USM - E.g.  [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/talesofarise/mods/43]Default Intro Opening Replacer[/url]﻿
[*]Engine Injector - E.g. [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/talesofarise/mods/292]Minimap to Compass HUD[/url]﻿﻿ & [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/talesofarise/mods/248]Multiplayer Mod[/url]﻿
[/list]
[size=5]Installation
[/size][list=1]
[*]Download

[*]Open your Vortex client and click on the 'Drop Files' icon under the 'Extensions' tab
[*]Select this extension
[*]Restart Vortex
[*]Go to the 'Games' tab and you'll be able to find the 'Tales of Arise' game.
[/list][size=5]Develop[/size][size=4]
[/size][size=3]Open source at [/size][url=https://github.com/rdok/tales-of-arise_vortex-extension][size=3]https://github.com/rdok/tales-of-arise_vortex-extension[/size][size=5]
[/size][/url]﻿[size=5]
[/size]

description.short: Provides basic Vortex support to manage mods for "Gothic 3".
description.long:
[quote]Gothic 3 Vortex Support extension is a great tool for gamers who want to automate installing [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/gothic3]Gothic 3 mods[/url]﻿ through Vortex. For example, you can automate installing the most endorsed mod for overall game appearance improvement [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/gothic3/mods/3]ENB or Reshade with SweetFX for Gothic 3[/url]﻿, with the most notable improvement of increasing view distance to the max. With this Vortex extension support, gamers can easily manage their mods and make sure they are properly installed. It's a great way to customize your gaming experience and make the game more enjoyable.[/quote]

This setup is designed to be minimalistic for managing mods for Gothic 3. In its current version, mods must be installed to the specified path in order to be successfully installed. I utilized the https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/155 wizard to generate the necessary files for this setup. Luckily, Gothic 3 exe is located at the root of the folder, which means this extension can install the current mods available out of the box.

[size=4]Installation[/size]
[list]
[*]Until Nexus approves this extension, you'll have to manually download it.
[*]To install, go to your Vortex, and click on the 'Drop Files' icon under the 'Extensions' tab
[*]Select this extension
[*]Restart Vortex
[*]Go to the 'Games' tab and you'll be able to find the 'Gothic 3' game.
[*]Activate it.
[/list]
[size=4]Use Case - Install [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/gothic3/mods/3]ENB or Reshade with SweetFX for Gothic 3[/url]﻿[/size]
[list]
[*]Download the mod manually
[*]Open Vortex, and click the 'Mods' tab
[*]Click 'Install from File' and open the downloaded zip mod file
[*]Double click on mod and change 'Mod Type' to 'Engine Injector'. This instructs Vortes to dump the files on the root game folder as they are. See screenshot below.
[*]Aprove any prompt from Vortex required for elevated rights.
[/list]
This mod also requires the GE3.ini file tweak to enable for the view distance rendering and other settings. This has also been automated through the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/gothic3/mods/21/]Highest Settings Ini[/url] mod.

If you have any issues with changed files, and then simply re deploy mods.
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/503/503-1672179742-1589322895.png[/img]

description.short: This is an extension that integrates Vortex with esoui.com so that you can use Vortex to manage the most popular Elder Scrolls Online addons
description.long:
Minion v3 is old and Minion v4 isn't being actively developed. Vortex would make a nice replacement if only it worked with [url=https://www.esoui.com/community.php]ESO UI[/url]. Well, thanks to this extension, it does! Browse ESO UI Addons from inside Vortex, install and manage the addons like any other game and enjoy the benefits of a mod manager that gets active updates!

[size=5]Features
[/size]
This extension has the following features available right now:

[list=1]
[*]Browse ESO UI addons from inside Vortex
[*]Install ESO UI addons with the Install button inside the Addon List
[*]Have all dependencies for a mod installed automatically. No more having to install an addon just to find out you need to install five more before it'll work.
[*]In the "Downloads" settings of Vortex, enable Automatic Addon Updates! When they update, they'll automatically install any new libs that they've added in that update!

[*]When an addon updates and has new dependencies, it'll automatically install those for you
[*]Want to see the addon on ESO UI? Just right-click it and Open it in ESO UI
[*]After installing a [url=https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/esouivortex/mpgejlffnbfhomnkopanhffaeekhklah]Chrome[/url]﻿/[url=https://addons.mozilla.org/en-GB/firefox/addon/eso-ui-vortex-download/?utm_source=addons.mozilla.org&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=search]Firefox [/url]﻿extension, esoui.com will have an "Install With Vortex" button on each mod page, allowing one-click installs straight from your browser



[/list][size=5]Having Issues?[/size]

This extension is still new and may have some issues here and there. If you're confused about how to do specific actions or if you come across any bugs, please post a comment and I'll try to respond or make a fix as soon as possible.

The source code for this extension can be found on [url=https://github.com/Garethp/Vortex-ESOUI]Github[/url]

Vortex support for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/cardsurvivaltropicalisland]Card Survival: Tropical Island[/url].

[size=5]Usage[/size]

[*]JSON mod will be deployed to a subfolder named with the Name property in the Modinfo.json.
[*]Just for testing, and any comments and suggestions are welcome.
[/list]

description.short: Adds support for Chained Echoes to Vortex, enabling you to easily automate installation of mods for Chained Echoes without having to worry about where the files are supposed to go, etc.
description.long:
[size=6]Description[/size][line]
[size=3]This extension adds support for Chained Echoes to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex Mod Manager[/url], enabling you to easily automate installation of mods for Chained Echoes without having to worry about where the files are supposed to go, etc.

At this time, only BepInEx plugins & patchers are supported.

If you are making a different kind of mod and would like it to be supported by this extension, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/edit/?tab=posts]please leave a comment on the posts tab[/url] with a link to your mod page so that I can take a look at how you are packaging the mod and how you expect users to install it manually, so that I can then have Vortex automate this process.[/size]


[size=6]How to install[/size][line]
[size=3]This extension requires [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] >= 1.7.5. To install, click the Vortex button at the top of the page to open this extension within Vortex, and then click [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Install[/font].

You can also manually install it by downloading the main file and dragging it into the "drop zone" labelled [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Drop File(s)[/font] in the Extensions tab at the bottom right.

Afterwards, restart Vortex and you can begin installing supported Chained Echoes mods with Vortex.[/size]


[center][size=5][b]The rest of this page is intended for mod authors only.
Users can simply follow the instructions above to install, and you're done![/b][/size]﻿[/center]


[size=6]How to make my mod compatible with this extension?[/size][line]
[size=3]This extension currently makes use of the [url=https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/extension-modtype-bepinex]modtype-bepinex[/url] extension officially provided by Nexus Mods to install BepInEx plugins & patchers.

For compatibility, your package [i]should not[/i] contain a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx[/font] folder.

Patcher assemblies [i]must[/i] be packaged within a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]patchers[/font] folder for the extension to recognise the assemblies as patchers.

Plugin assemblies [i]may[/i] be packaged within a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]plugins[/font] folder, but it is not necessary - the extension will automatically assume assemblies that are not packaged within a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]patchers[/font] folder are plugins.

In either case, assemblies may be packaged within a subfolder named after the mod, which is useful if your mod generates or is shipped with extra files, to keep the folder tidy and prevent mods overwriting each other.

Don't forget to set your latest main file as your main Vortex file, and make sure that the [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Remove the 'Download with manager' button[/font] option is unticked![/size]


[size=5]Packaging Examples[/size]


[size=4]BepInEx plugins[/size]

[size=3][code]- MyBepInExPlugin.dll[/code]

[code]- plugins
﻿- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]

[code]- My BepInEx Plugin
﻿- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]

[code]- plugins
﻿- My BepInEx Plugin
﻿ ﻿- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
﻿ ﻿- README.txt
[/code][/size]

[size=4]BepInEx patchers[/size]

[size=3][code]- patchers
﻿- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
[/code]

[code]- patchers
﻿- My BepInEx Patcher
﻿ ﻿- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
﻿ ﻿- README.txt
[/code][/size]

[size=4]﻿BepInEx plugin/patcher combos[/size]

[size=3][code]- patchers
﻿- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
- plugins
﻿- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code]

[code]- patchers
﻿﻿- My Mod Name
﻿ ﻿﻿- MyBepInExPatcher.dll
- plugins
﻿- My Mod Name
﻿ ﻿- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
[/code][/size]

[size=5]My mod is being installed strangely![/size]

[size=3]If you have followed the packaging examples above and your mod is still being incorrectly installed by this extension, [url=?tab=bugs]please file a report on the bugs tab[/url] with a link to your mod page and I'll take a look and see if I can get it fixed.[/size]


[size=5]Why can't I package my mod with a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx[/font] folder?[/size]

[size=3]At this time, the [url=https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/extension-modtype-bepinex]modtype-bepinex[/url] extension developed by Nexus Mods staff (which this extension utilises) expects BepInEx plugins & patchers to be packaged [i]without[/i] a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx[/font] folder. I have seen examples where plugins which are packaged within a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx\plugins[/font] folder structure end up with the entire package being installed as e.g. [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx\plugins\BepInEx\plugins\MyPlugin.dll[/font]. In this case, the plugin should still work most of the time unless it relies on hard-coded paths (which is an ill-advised practice for multiple reasons, including potentially leading to issues on operating systems other than the one on which you developed the mod). However, it is still advised not to package your files within a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx[/font] folder to avoid this issue.

If the reason you wanted to include a [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx[/font] folder is because you want files to be installed in the root folder of the game, I would urge you to consider if you really [i]need[/i] this for your mod to function.

In the case that you are placing configuration files in the root game folder, it is encouraged - though not required - to instead use BepInEx's built-in method for handling configuration, as this will automatically make your mod's configuration compatible with the [url=https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx.ConfigurationManager]Configuration Manager[/url] plugin - among others - which is a free win both for you as a plugin developer and for your users.

This method results in your configuration files living in [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx\config[/font], as is standard practice for BepInEx plugins. There is no need to package these configuration files with the plugin, as BepInEx automatically generates the files, populated with default values which you define, whenever your plugin interacts with these config entries. [size=3][url=https://docs.bepinex.dev/articles/dev_guide/plugin_tutorial/4_configuration.html]Please see the BepInEx documentation for examples[/url].[/size]

If you prefer to use another method for handling configuration files, it is advised to store them within the [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]BepInEx\config[/font] folder, as this is standard practice for BepInEx plugins.

If you were placing any other type of file in the root folder of the mod, it is a better practice to instead install them within a subfolder of the plugins/patchers folder, along with your plugin/patcher assemblies. This is especially true in the case of readmes, licenses, changelogs etc.[/size]

description.short: Vortex Extension for Hogwarts Legacy
description.long:
[size=4][b]Vortex Extension for Hogwarts Legacy
[/b][/size]
This is an extension for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] to add support for Hogwarts Legacy. This is available for the PC on [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/990080/Hogwarts_Legacy/]Steam[/url] and [url=https://store.epicgames.com/en-US/p/hogwarts-legacy]Epic[/url].

[size=3]Features[/size]
[list]
[*][size=2]Support for PAK-based mods[/size]
[*][size=2]Support for BK2-based mods (movie files)[/size]
[*][size=2]Support for UE4SS Blueprint\Lua mods[/size]
[*][size=2]Support for load order of PAK mods[/size]
[*][size=2]Support for Lua mods enabling and disabling[/size]
[*][size=2]Automatic game detection[/size]
[/list]
[size=3][b]Installation[/b][/size]

This extension requires Vortex >= 1.7.5. To install, click the Vortex button at the top of the page to open this extension within Vortex, and then click Install.

You can also manually install it by downloading the main file and dragging it into the 'drop zone' labelled Drop File(s) in the Extensions tab at the bottom right.

Afterwards, restart Vortex and you can begin installing supported Hogwarts Legacy mods with Vortex. If updating an extension, migration occurs that purges your mods folder and reinstalls any mods.

[b][size=3]Game detection
[/size][/b]
The Hogwarts Legacy game extension enables Vortex to automatically locate installs from the Steam and Epic apps.
It is also possible to manually set the game folder if the auto detection doesn't find the correct installation. A valid Hogwarts Legacy game folder contains:

[list]
[*]HogwartsLegacy.exe
[*]/Engine
[*]/Phoenix
[/list]

If your game lacks these files/folders then it is likely that your installation has become corrupted somehow.

[size=3][b]Mod Management
[/b][/size]
By default, Vortex will deploy files to the game's root folder and extracts the archive while preserving the folder structure.

Vortex will deploy files to the game's mod folder (`/Phoenix/Content/Paks/~mods`) if only `.pak` files are detected and extracts all nested files in the archive to their own individual within this one, ignoring archive folder structure. Each mod folder will be prefixed based on the users load order set within Vortex. Any files that are overwritten are backed up for when the mod is disabled or removed.

This extension also supports mods that overwrite the games movie files, located within subfolders under `/Phoenix/Content/Movies`. When a mod is added that contains at least 1 `.bk2` file, the `hogwarts-modtype-movies` installer is used. This searches through the movies folder within the game and attempts to match anything that matches inside of the mod archive. If found, Vortex overwrites them (after backing up the originals) and if any `pak` files are also found within a movie mod, then these are processed the same as a pak-only mod.

[size=3][b]Load Order
[/b][/size]
The load order of mods can now be set within Vortex to allow greater control over what mods are loaded before other mods. This is important so as multiple mods can change the same thing and so load order can be used to minimize collisions. Mods loaded last will have priority over mods loaded first.

[size=3][b]See also
[/b][/size]
[list]
[*][url=https://github.com/lordvoldem0rt/game-hogwartslegacy]Source Code (GitHub)[/url]﻿
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/hogwartslegacy]Mods for Hogwarts Legacy (Nexus Mods)[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Download Vortex (Nexus Mods)[/url]
[*][url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/Category:Vortex]Vortex Knowledge Base (Nexus Mods)[/url]
[/list]

description.short: Adds Anno 1800 support to Vortex
description.long:
[size=4][b]Vortex Extension for Anno 1800[/b][/size]

This is an extension for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] to add support for Anno 1800. This is available for the PC on [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/916440/Anno_1800/]Steam[/url], [url=https://store.epicgames.com/en-US/p/anno-1800]Epic[/url] and [url=https://store.ubi.com/uk/game?pid=5b647010ef3aa548048c5958&dwvar_5b647010ef3aa548048c5958_Platform=pcdl&edition=Standard%20Edition&source=detail]Ubisoft[/url].

[size=3][b]Features[/b][/size]

[list]
[*]Support for managing mods that use the [url=https://github.com/xforce/anno1800-mod-loader]Xforce Mod Loader[/url] (see below).
[*]Automatic game detection.
[/list]
[size=3][b]Game detection[/b][/size]

The Anno 1800 game extension enables Vortex to automatically locate installs from Steam and Ubisoft Connect apps.
It is also possible to manually set the game folder if the auto detection doesn't find the correct installation. A valid Anno 1800 game folder contains:

[code]/Bin/Win64/Anno1800.exe
[/code]
If your game lacks these files/folders then it is likely that your installation has become corrupted somehow.

[size=3][b]Mod Management[/b]
[/size]
This extension will automatically download and install the Xforce Mod Loader from GitHub if it isn't detected as nearly all mods require it. See [url=https://github.com/xforce/anno1800-mod-loader]Xforce's GitHub[/url] for information.

The mods will be deployed to the game's mod folder ([code single]/mods[/code]) and will respect the folder structure within the archive file as this is necessary for the mod loader to work. Any files that are overwritten are backed up for when the mod is disabled or removed.
[size=3]
[b]See also
[/b][/size]
- [url=https://github.com/xforce/anno1800-mod-loader]Xforce's Mod Loader (GitHub)[/url]
- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/anno1800]Mods for Anno 1800 (Nexus Mods)[/url]
- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Download Vortex (Nexus Mods)[/url]
- [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/Category:Vortex]Vortex Knowledge Base (Nexus Mods)[/url]

description.short: This extension allows you to manage your downloaded mods for The Quarry directly through Vortex.
description.long:
To make installation of mods for [b]The Quarry[/b] quick and easy, I have now programmed an extension for the [u][b]Vortex Mod Manager[/b][/u].

Every modification for this game can now be managed and downloaded through Vortex to customize your modded game experience.

The extension's current supported features are listed in the Files-Section.

[b]ATTENTION: This Vortex Support-Extension skips the 2K Launcher included with the game when launching through Vortex. When launched from Steam, it redirects to the 2K Launcher to launch The Quarry, however it does not seem to be necessary for the game, even causing perfomance issues as I heard.

(I have no option currently to make the 2K Launcher compatible with this Vortex Extension)

If you want to play with mods and use the 2K Launcher for any reason, launch the game directly through Steam instead of Vortex after activating your selection of mods.
[/b]
(It's recommended to have [b]Automatic Active Mod Deployment[/b] enabled in Vortex)

description.short: Vortex Mod Manager support for Derail Valley mods, skins, custom cars, sounds, and maps.
description.long:
[color=#6aa84f][size=4][b]Now compatible with DV: Simulator
[/b][/size][/color][color=#f1c232][size=4][b]Remember to check compatibility of other mods before installing! Many/most Overhauled mods are in need of updates![/b][/size][/color]

Allows the management and automatic install of the most common mod types for Derail Valley:

[list]
[*]Code Mods (DLL based mods)
[*]Skins ([url=https://www.nexusmods.com/derailvalley/mods/34]Skin Manager[/url]﻿ content) (both overhauled & simulator versions)

[*]New Maps ([url=https://www.nexusmods.com/derailvalley/mods/593]Mapify[/url]﻿ content)
[/list]
When first adding the Derail Valley profile to Vortex, you will be prompted to install Unity Mod Manager if it is not found on your system. The UMM extension will add a tool launcher to Vortex. [b]You must run the tool at least once and install UMM into Derail Valley using the "doorstop proxy" method before you will be able to run any mods.[/b] After the mod manager is installed into the game, if it continues to pop up when trying to launch Derail Valley, open the menu next to the tool icon and select "unset as primary".

When installing any of the content type mods, you will be prompted to also install the corresponding content manager mod if it is missing. The extension also tries to detect skins that are bundled inside custom cars, and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/derailvalley/mods/197]Number Manager[/url] configurations that are bundled within skins.

Extension Source Code is hosted on [url=https://github.com/derail-valley-modding/vortex-extension]GitHub[/url]﻿ - please create a new issue there for any bugs you might encounter

extensions.author: toebeann

description.short: Easy RPC over Named Pipes for Vortex.
description.long:
[center][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/530/530-1678005579-2131505409.png[/img][/center]

[size=6]Installation[/size][line]
[size=3]This extension requires [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] >= 1.7.0. To install, click the Vortex button at the top of the page to open this extension within Vortex, and then click [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Install[/font]. Alternatively, within Vortex, go to the [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Extensions[/font] tab, click "[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Find More[/font]" at the bottom of the tab, search for "npc for Vortex", and then click [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Install[/font].

You can also manually install it by downloading the main file and dragging it into the "drop zone" labelled "[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Drop File(s)[/font]" in the [font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Extensions[/font] tab at the bottom right.

Afterwards, simply restart Vortex to activate the extension.[/size]

[size=5][center][b]The rest of this page is intended for developers only.
Users can simply follow the instructions above to install, and you're done![/b][/center][/size]
[size=6]Description[/size][line]
[size=3]npc for Vortex brings the power of [url=https://toebeann.github.io/npc/]npc[/url] to Vortex, making it simple for you to expose npc procedures from a Vortex extension.[/size]

[size=3]With npc, it is trivial to expose a function in Vortex which can then be called by another running process on the user's machine, e.g. a BepInEx plugin, a Node.js app, really anything that can run code and access named pipes.[/size]

[size=3]At this time, npc only has an official library in Node.js. A .NET npc client library is currently in active development.[/size]

[size=3]This extension also exposes several built-in functions of Vortex to be called via [url=https://toebeann.github.io/npc/]npc[/url].[/size]

[size=3]For Node.js and general Vortex extension development, we also recommend that you install the following packages:

[list]
[*][url=https://toebeann.github.io/npc-vortex-api/]@toebean/npc-vortex-api[/url]
[*][url=https://zod.dev]zod[/url]
[/list][/size]
[size=6]Usage guide[/size][line]
[size=3]A full recommended usage guide can be found in the [url=https://toebeann.github.io/npc-vortex-api/stable/#usage]@toebean/npc-vortex-api documentation[/url].[/size]

description.short: Vortex support for Vendetta Online 1.8.xxx
description.long:
[size=4]Vortex Extension for Vendetta Online[/size]

This is an extension for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] to add support for Vendetta Online. This is available for the PC from the [url=http://vendetta-online.com/]game's website[/url]. 

No, Vortex is not meant for managing games on Linux, MacOS, Android, iOS, or mobileVR platforms. To manage Vendetta Online plugins on those platforms, visit the [url=http://discord.gg/vendetta]game's discord[/url] and ask for help in manually managing mods there.
[size=3]
[b]Game detection[/b][/size]

The Vendetta Online game extension enables Vortex to automatically locate the installation directory from the registry.
It is also possible to manually set the game folder if the auto detection doesn't find the correct installation. A valid Vendetta Online game folder contains:

[code]/vendetta.rlb
[/code]
If your game lacks this file then it is likely that your installation has become corrupted somehow.

[size=3][b]Mod Management[/b]
[/size]
The mods will be deployed to the game's mod folder (the [u][i]/plugins[/i][/u] directory) and will respect the folder structure within the archive file (which should be single-nested before the mod's code). 

Deployment method MUST be hardlink; the symlink method is NOT compatible with Vendetta Online's plugin loading system.
[size=3]
[b]See also[/b]
[/size]

[/url]- [url=http://vo-wiki.com/]Vendetta Online Community Wiki[/url]

[b][font=Tahoma][u][size=5]FAQ[/size]
[/u][/font][/b]
[color=#ff7700]To install[/color]:
Method 1: Use the Vortex button, and install (From "Downloads" if no popup), restart Vortex.
Method 2: Alternatively manually download and drop the zipped file where it says to in Vortex Extensions tab.

If neither work make sure these are up-to-date:
Vortex - 'Settings > Vortex > Update' should [b]NOT[/b] say "No automatic updates".
Browse Extensions list - Press the refresh button on the bottom before installing.

[color=#ff7700]Activate in Vortex by going to[/color]:﻿
Settings > Theme > Theme Dropdown > Skyrim Theme


[font=Tahoma][u][b][size=5]Customize[/size][/b][/u][size=3]
[/size]With [b]4.0[/b] live it's a better time to try this out then ever!
[i]Permissions have been changed until 5.0, make sure to view them.[/i]
[/font]
Some things you can change:
[list]
[*]Colors!
[*]Images! [Title & (optionally) interactive Side Bar]
[*]Custom Cursor!
[*]Fonts! [normal and [font=Comic Sans MS]special[/font] sections]
[*]Enable Button Borders
[/list]
@Healz4Life in the [url=https://discord.com/invite/nexusmods]Nexus Mods Discord[/url] if you have any questions or suggestions!

[color=#ff7700]Files & Setup:[/color]
You'll need to clone the theme to make changes, and navigate to it's folder.
Open Vortex, go to [u]Settings>Theme[/u] and press [u]Clone[/u]
Ex. file path: [quote]C:\Users\[b]NAME[/b]\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\themes\Skyrim - Night Sky 4.0 by Healz4Life[/quote][color=#ff7700]customChanges.scss[/color] (enable disable or edit features) and [color=#ff7700]myVariables.scss [/color](swap an image or font)
[color=#ff7700]style.scss[/color] contains all misc changes,[color=#d8d8d8][b] also needed to be used to set file directory path for images[/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/12?tab=posts]Developer Tools[/url] [/color]extension for vortex (Very useful)

[color=#ff7700]To change any image:[/color]
Replace the image URL with your own custom image using a [url=https://www.base64-image.de/]Base 64[/url], regular image link (online only), or full file path. 

[color=#ff7700]How to comment or uncomment:[/color]
// <-- This comments a line when at the front of it, you can delete that to uncomment it too.
/* <-- This is for when you want to comment out a whole section (Better then leaving brackets empty) --> */

description.short:
An Vortex Extension for Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot.
This addon/extension to Vortex will give the app support for installing mods for the game should you wish to use Vortex as the Mod Manager for the game.
description.long:
[size=4]An Vortex Extension for Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot.[/size]

This addon/extension to Vortex will give the app support for installing mods for the game should you wish to use Vortex as the Mod Manager for the game.
Its very simple and created by using the code and examples from the wiki: https://modding.wiki/en/vortex/developer/create-a-game-extension

[list]
[*]Supports the Steam version of the game. (The only PC version to my knowledge)
[*]Installs .PAK mods (Pretty much all mods except Reshade)
[*]Removes folders and sub-folders from mods zip-files automatically.

[/list]
I will notify the Vortex developers about this extension, perhaps they will consider adding it to the official client.


[size=4]Installation[/size]
Since its not an official extension yet you will need to manually add it to Vortex.
[list=1]
[*]Open the Vortex application
[*]Go to the Extensions page
[*]Drag and drop the game-dragonballzkakarot.zip on the "Drop File(s)" zone [b]or[/b] click on it to browse the file.
[*]Restart Vortex
[*]Go to the Games page.
[*]Search for "Dragon ball Z" and the game should show up.
[*]Click on the game to add it. Done!
[/list]

[size=4]Changelog:[/size]
Version 1.1.0 - Added removal of folders and subfolders within mod zip-files. Also checks that the mod is for the correct game.
Version 1.0.0 - First version[list=1]

[/list]

description.short:
Adds support for Vampire Survivors to Vortex, enabling you to easily automate installation of mods for Vampire Survivors without having to worry about where the files are supposed to go.
Its designed to work using the VS ModLoader by QKekos for the Old Engine. The New Engine requires MelonLoader
description.long:
[size=6]Vampire Survivors Support for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url][/size]


[size=5]Description[/size]


[size=3]This extension adds support for Vampire Survivors to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex Mod Manager[/url], enabling you to easily automate installation of mods for Vampire Survivors without having to worry about where the files are supposed to go, etc.


At this time following mod types are supported:
[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Mods that are designed for the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url]﻿ by QKekos and use the right file structure (e.g resources/app/.webpack/.../img.jpg)[/size][size=3][/size]
[*][size=3]Other Mods that use the right file structure (e.g resources/app/.webpack/.../img.jpg)[/size]
[*][size=3]Mods for the New Engine that use the right file structure (e.g Mods/mod.dll)[/size]
[/list][size=3]
Note that mods for the Old Engine that change the same file and [b]DON'T[/b] use the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url] will [b]NOT WORK[/b].
Note that mods for the New Engine have to be made for [url=https://github.com/LavaGang/MelonLoader/releases]MelonLoader[/url]

Mods that only contain the file to change also won't work.


[/size][size=5]Currently Supported Mods[/size][size=3]
[/size]
[size=4]Old Engine:[/size]
[list]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url]﻿[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/50]Multiperpose QoL Mod[/url]﻿[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/61]Castlevania Survivors[/url]﻿[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/60]Extendend Power Up Levels[/url]﻿﻿[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/63]Eggs Bulk Buy﻿[/url]﻿[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/65]Movement Speed Cap[/url]﻿[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/53]Tekken 3 Chicken Sound Effect[/url]﻿ (NO ModLoader)[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/17]Exorcismus - Unholy Vespers Skin Mod[/url]﻿ (NO ModLoader)[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/19]Remove Cat Sounds[/url]﻿ (NO ModLoader)[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/58]Forest A audio to Brodyquest[/url]﻿ (NO ModLoader)[/size]
[*][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/80]Better Lama Armor[/url]﻿ (NO ModLoader)[/size]
[/list][size=4]
New Engine:[/size]
[list]
[*]No Mods Supported at the moment
[/list][size=5]
How to install[/size]


[size=3]This extension requires [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url]. To install, click the Vortex button at the top of the page to open this extension within Vortex, and then click Install. Alternatively, within Vortex, go to the Extensions tab, click "Find More" at the bottom of the tab, search for "Vampire Survivors Support" and then click Install.

You can also manually install it by downloading the main file and dragging it into the "drop zone" labelled "Drop File(s)" in the Extensions tab at the bottom right.

Afterwards, restart Vortex and you can begin installing supported [size=3]Vampire Survivors[/size] mods with Vortex.


[/size][size=5]Known Issues[/size][size=3]

[/size][size=4]
Old Engine Black Screen[/size][size=3]:
If you encounter a black screen this is most likely because of 2 reasons.
1. You enabled the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url] but no other mod. If the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url] is enabled alone it causes a black screen.
2. You're using one of Kekos mods which have some issues with Vortex files because they try to load Vortex files as mods. These issues could also occur on other mods.
[b]UPDATE: This now gets fixed automatically by the Extension uppon installing the Mod[/b]

To fix this you just need to add the following line into the main mod file (typically called [modname].js):

[/size][code].filter((dir) => dir.isFile() && dir.name !== "__folder_managed_by_vortex")
[/code]

[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/593/593-1687611333-1920971107.jpeg[/img]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/2295/images/593/593-1687968888-146425820.jpeg[/img]
﻿For the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/50]Multiperpose QoL Mod[/url] the file would be [i]MultipurposeQolMod.js[/i] and for the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/61]Castlevania Survivors[/url] Mod it would be [i]Castlevania.js[/i]


[size=5]How to make my Mod compatible with this Extension[/size]

[size=4]For the Old Engine:[/size]
[size=3]To make your mod compatible you either need to make your mod compatible with the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url]﻿, or you use the right file structure for your mod. Note though that if you do the latter mods that try to change the same file will overwrite yours, so it is recommended to use the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url]﻿.

Vampire Survivors is structured like this (most basic representation):[/size]
[code]﻿/Vampire Survivors
|--> VampireSurvivors.exe
|--> resources
﻿|--> app
﻿ ﻿|--> .webpack
﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> renderer
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> index.html
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> main.bundle.js
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> mod_loader (only if you installed VS ModLoader)
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> mods
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> your mod
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> assets
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> img
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> sfx
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> tilesets

[/code]
[size=3]So if you use the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url] your file structure always looks like this:
[code]|--> resources
﻿|--> app
﻿ ﻿|--> .webpack
﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> renderer
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> mod_loader
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> mods
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> [your mod]
[/code][/size][size=3]
If you don't use the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url] your file structure can vary but should always contain every folder before your file until resources is reached. An example for the UI.png file:
[code]|--> resources
﻿|--> app
﻿ ﻿|--> .webpack
﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> renderer
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> assets
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> img
﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿ ﻿|--> UI.png
[/code][/size]
[size=3]Note that the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/vampiresurvivors/mods/64]VS ModLoader[/url] only works if another mod is actually active / installed.
[/size]
[size=4]For the New Engine[/size]
[size=3]To make your mod compatible your mod needs to be created for the [url=https://github.com/LavaGang/MelonLoader/releases]MelonLoader[/url]. If that is the case you just need the right file structure for your mod. All Modfiles go into the Mods folder of MelonLoader. If you access other files within your Mod note that this Extension just copies everything as it is. So a file in "Mods/mod.dll" will be copied to "Mods/mod.dll". Most of the time you want your files to be in the Mods folder if that is the case your file structure would look like this:[/size]
[size=3][code]|--> Mods
﻿|--> mod1.dll
﻿|--> mod2.dll
[/code][/size][size=3]
If you have a file for example a font that needs to go in the UserData folder it would look like this;
[/size][code][size=3]|--> Mods
﻿|--> mod1.dll
﻿|--> mod2.dll
|--> UserData
﻿|--> font.ttf[/size]
[/code]

[size=3]For Questions and Support you can also go to the [url=https://github.com/Der-Floh/Vampire-Survivors-Support-for-Vortex]Github Repository[/url][/size]

description.short: A simple little utility to check how many API requests you have left and when they reset.
description.long:
If you are being rate limited (receiving error 429 inside Vortex) please see the [url=https://help.nexusmods.com/article/105-i-have-reached-a-daily-or-hourly-limit-api-requests-have-been-consumed-rate-limit-exceeded-what-does-this-mean]help article here[/url].

This extension allows you to see how many API requests you have left in the current 24-hour and 1-hour period. (Note: If you're completely out of requests, this extension may not be able to show you any information).

Once the extension is installed, you can open the top-right menu to select the option "Check API Limits" which will create a notification showing the remaining request totals.

This extension was created for an internal test, but I thought it might be handy for others too!

description.short: Vortex Support for Plants vs. Zombies: Game of the Year
description.long:
[font=Trebuchet MS]Adds Vortex support for [b]Plants vs. Zombies: Game of the Year[/b].
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/plantsvszombiesgoty]PvZ GOTY on Nexus[/url]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/3590/Plants_vs_Zombies_GOTY_Edition/]PvZ GOTY on Steam[/url]

[size=4][color=#ffff00]~ PAK Mods[/color]
[/size]Mods that contain a modified PAK and/or other standalone files do not require any particular structure for Vortex to install them correctly, although the relevant files cannot be in any undesired sub-folders when zipped.

These are very easy to install and don't require any set-up on the player's end, but are completely incompatible with other mods.

[size=4][color=#ffff00]~ "Raw Files" Mods[/color]
[/size]"Raw files" mods require the game's [b]main.pak[/b] to be extracted into the game's root folder. The [b]main.pak[/b] itself must then also be removed from the root folder (this can be done by moving its location or renaming the file to something like [b]Xmain.pak[/b]).

[url=https://i.imgur.com/cSLqoln.png]An example of folder set-up[/url] (image)

If you do not have a tool to extract the PAK yourself, you can install the necessary files [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/plantsvszombiesgoty/mods/4]here[/url]﻿. It also goes more in-depth on why you should use this method.

Once the player has set this up, it will be very easy to install mods from then on, and will allow for much greater compatibility with other mods than simply installing PAK mods.

Mods that do not follow the correct structure will still be installed, but won't work. Mods that have additional root folders will be fine, as the correct folders will be extracted.[/font]

description.short: Starfield support for Vortex.
description.long:
This is an extension for Vortex to add support for Starfield. The Steam and Xbox versions of Starfield are both supported, although there are differences between the two.

[size=4][b]Features[/b][/size]

[list]
[*]Check (and ask to fix) bare minimum setup of StarfieldCustom.ini
[*]Can support both /Data folders through the use of a folder junction. Defaults to off but is asked to enable with necessary warnings. Please [url=https://modding.wiki/en/vortex/users/starfield-folder-junction-issues]read this page on modding.wiki[/url] for more information.
[*]Supports SFSE, BethINI and SFEdit
[/list]
[size=4][b]Installation[/b]
[/size]
This extension requires Vortex **1.9.10** or greater.

To install, click the Vortex button at the top of the Starfield Extension page on Nexus Mods, and then click Install.

You can also manually install it by click the Manual button at the top of the page and dragging it into the drop target labelled Drop File(s) in the Extensions page at the bottom right.

Afterwards, restart Vortex and you can begin installing supported Starfield mods with Vortex.

[size=4][b]Game detection
[/b][/size]
The Starfield game extension enables Vortex to automatically locate installs from the Steam and Xbox apps.

It is also possible to manually set the game folder if the auto detection doesn't find the correct installation. A valid Starfield game folder contains:
[list]
[*]Starfield.exe
[/list]
If your game lacks this file then it is likely that your installation has become corrupted somehow.

[b]Important note if managing the game through Xbox game pass:[/b]

Currently the game discovery will resolve to the game's default WindowsApps location - Vortex's access to this directory is very limited due to the game store locking the files in a system owned virtual file system. As a workaround, please install the game into an external location, e.g. C:/XboxGames/ and manually set the game folder inside Vortex to the C:\XboxGames\Starfield\Content folder. You should then be able to create the folder junction and mod your game.

[size=4][b]Mod Management
[/b][/size]
By default, Vortex will deploy files to the game's root folder and extracts the archive while preserving the folder structure.
Starfield breaks the Bethesda-game trend by having a secondary data folder at Documents\My Games\Starfield\Data which, in most case, overrides the regular \Data folder within the game installation. This has caused quite a bit of confusion in the community with different mods providing instructions to install to the two different folders and a number of community workarounds - some that worked and some less so.

To get around this, Vortex can create a specific type of shortcut (called a folder junction) between the regular Data folder and the one in the My Games folder. This tricks the game engine into using the same Data folder and simplifies mod installation. As an added bonus, this also works for both Steam and Xbox versions. The My Games Data folder is tested on startup and if it isn't a junction already, then the user is notified about potentially enabling this feature along with documentation as to why the user may not want to.

[quote][b]IMPORTANT: [/b]Things aren't all perfect though. Using a file syncing\cloud drive service such as OneDrive, Google Drive or Dropbox are known to cause issues with this method due to the inconsistencies in how they handle folder junctions. The most severe of these issues can lead to the loss of data. For compatibility information about individual services, please read this page on modding.wiki for more information.[/quote]
Similar to Fallout 4, Starfield requires certain INI tweaks to be set in order to properly load loose files (i.e. those not packed in BA2 archives). There are a lot of mods out there which provide instructions for users to add these tweaks to a StarfieldCustom.ini file in the Documents\My Games\Starfield folder. If Vortex detects that this ini doesn't exist or is incorrect, it will notify the user and ask to fix it. If fix is requested, it will add or adjust the "bInvalidateOlderFiles" and "sResourceDataDirsFinal" values without changing any other settings you might've added manually.

[s]Additionally, Vortex will apply a tweak to re-route your Photo Mode captures to Data\Textures\Photos (unless you've already set it to something else) and there is now a button inside Vortex to quickly open this folder.[/s] This was removed in version 0.6.7 of the extension due to a bug in Starfield that was introduced when the game updated to approximately version 1.10.31.0.

[size=4][b]Plugin Load Ordering (0.6.x)[/b][/size]

The current implementation of the plugin management system in Starfield is temporary while we wait for the official creation kit from Bethesda. This means that we expect certain functionality to change in the future, yet we're confident enough to provide interim support.

A new "Load Order" page has been added to the extension to allow users to view their deployed mods and manage their load order. By default this system is disabled and can only be enabled through the Load Order page. The user can disable this feature at any time through the Settings -> Mods -> Starfield -> Manage Load Order Toggle.

Before enabling the plugin management system keep the following in mind:

[list]
[*]Vortex will download any required mods/tools for load ordering to function as soon as you enable the plugin management system.
[*]Vortex will migrate any "sTestFileX=" entries it finds in the INI files to the plugins.txt file located inside "%APPLOCALDATA%/Starfield". Any INI entries will block the plugin management functionality from working. This is by Bethesda's design.
[*]Game Pass version of the game will not be able to use SFSE or its plugins - the [Ultimate-ASI-Loader](https://github.com/ThirteenAG/Ultimate-ASI-Loader) is used to load plugins to the game instead.
[*]Native plugins are not serialized to the "plugins.txt" file.
[/list]
[size=4][b]Known Issues
[/b][/size]
This extension has been tested with all of the most popular mods, installers, script extenders, mod fixers etc. Please see this [url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/13262847-starfield-mod-compatibility-megathread/]Mod Compatibility List forum post[/url] for details.

Symlink support has been disabled due inconsistencies with some files working and some not. Animation replacers don’t read symlinked, but textures seem ok. This does match the pattern of older Bethesda games which looked for a while like we could avoid.

Mods that include ini entries to be added won't fully work as functionality for ini merging isn't added yet. Deployment will work fine, but the ini (normally the StarfieldCustom.ini) will need to be updated manually. Please see a mod's description for individual installation instructions.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/starfield/mods/106]Starfield Script Extender (SFSE)[/url] is Steam version only and currently does not work with the Xbox Game Pass version.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/starfield/mods/111]PureDark's StarfieldUpscaler[/url] is manual install only, [url=https://www.dexerto.com/tech/how-to-add-dlss-to-starfield-on-pc-step-by-step-mod-guide-2274531/]this is a good guide[/url] to follow.

Mods needing ASI loading will require manual installation due to the complexities. Please see a mod's description for individual installation instructions.

Mods installed with version 0.4 of this extension may have missing files due to a flaw in the default installer. Please re-install your mods using 0.5 to ensure your mods are installed correctly. (Any missing archives will have to be re-downloaded manually). Fomods installed with 0.4 (selecting the "Vortex" flag) will no longer deploy correctly. 0.5 has a test in place to detect these mods and will notify you if any are found; providing you with the ability to fix the installed fomod. Mod authors are no longer required to provide separate Vortex/MO2 destinations for their mod files!

Migrating this extension from version 0.4 to 0.5 may fail if for any reason the files are being actively manipulated by other tools or the game itself. Please make sure to close any such tools (or the game) before migrating to 0.5

Modding Starfield's Xbox Game Pass version does not allow folder junctions when used with the default `WindowsApps\Starfield` older. Please ensure to install Starfield to an external location e.g. `C:\XboxGames\` Vortex will try to resolve custom game pass locations using the hidden .GamingRoot files which the game pass store creates. Alternatively, the location of the game can be set manually. Go to Games tab and find Starfield -> 3 dots top right of the game's thumbnail -> manually select location -> choose the game folder that contains `Starfield.exe`.

Mod management isn't an exact science so please report any mods that don't install correctly so we can continue to increase our compatibility and coverage.

[size=4][b]Migrating this extension to 0.5
[/b][/size]
The default installer in 0.4 has been deprecated in 0.5 due to:
[list]
[*]Flaws in its logic which could potentially strip out mod files, causing issues in-game.
[*]Limited support for different mod packaging patterns.
[*]Incorrect installation of FOMODs requiring mod authors to cater for different mod managers separately (MO2/Vortex)
[/list]
What to expect:
[list]
[*]As part of the migration, Vortex will purge all your mods as soon as Starfield is activated and will run checks to ensure your existing mods deploy correctly.
[*]Mods installed with 0.4 should still function as they previously did. If for any reason you suspect the mod has missing files, simply re-install it and the new installation logic will ensure that the mod is installed correctly.
[*]Collections that were created before 0.5 will still function correctly on both 0.4 and 0.5; however any collections created in 0.5 is not necessarily backwards compatible with 0.4 and could potentially result in a broken mod setup, especially if the mods included in the collection are known to cause issues in 0.4.
[*]FOMODs no longer require different file path configuration for different mod managers (MO2/Vortex). The user will be informed of any fomods it detects as misconfigured/outdated and allow them to fix them automatically via a notification.
[*]INI/TXT files will be deployed to the game's root folder; although the txt files can be executed using the 'bat' command in the game's console, Vortex does not currently offer automatic INI merging, those need to be sorted out manually.
[/list]
Recommendations:
[list]
[*]Although not necessary if you're happy with your current mod setup, it is highly advisable for ALL 0.5 users to re-install all of their mods to ensure that the new mod type system kicks in.
[/list]
[size=4][b]Collections in 0.5 and above
[/b][/size]
Given the changes in 0.5, migration functionality has been introduced to ensure we support collections created before this update. Upon successful installation of a collection, all mods tied to said collection are checked and migrated automatically to use the new system on the user's environment.

What to expect:
[list]
[*]Mods on the curator's machine may have a different mod type than the mods on the user's end, especially if the curator is still using an outdated version of the Starfield extension.
[*]As mentioned - mods installed as part of a collection on the user's end in 0.5 are automatically migrated to use the new 'Data Folder' mod type (when required). That will ensure the mods load into the game correctly.
[*]Existing collections downloaded before 0.5 should still be in a functional state.
[/list]
Recommendations:
[list]
[*]As a curator it is highly advisable to update to 0.5 as soon as possible and re-install any mods you wish to distribute as part of a collection.
[*]As a user, although existing collections should still be functional - re-installing the collection is recommended as it will update all your mods to the new mod type system.
[/list]
[size=4][b]Addendum[/b][/size]

Vortex 0.6.x load ordering functionality is using INI merging for global datasets defined in ASI mods. At the time of writing this addendum, the deepMerge utility function was not exported as part of the API. In order to allow users to test this extension without waiting for Vortex 1.9.9+, the extension has an identical copy of the deepMerge function included - this should be removed once we confirm 1.9.9+ is stable.

[size=4][b]See also
[/b][/size]
[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/starfield]Mods for Starfield (Nexus Mods)[/url]
[*][url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/13262847-starfield-mod-compatibility-megathread/]Starfield Mod Compatibility Megathread (Nexus Mods)[/url]

description.short: Korean Translation for Vortex
description.long:
[b][size=3]볼텍스에서 자동으로 설치하기[/size][/b]
  1. 볼텍스에서 로그인합니다.
  2. 좌측에 보이는 Settings 탭으로 들어갑니다.
  3. Interface 항목에서 언어를 한국어 (extension by starfield95)로 설정합니다.
  4. 볼텍스를 재시작 하면됩니다.

[b][size=3]수동으로 설치하기[/size][/b]
  1. 파일 항목에서 수동으로 다운로드 합니다.
  2. 압축을 풀어, ko폴더를 C:\Program Files\Black Tree Gaming Ltd\Vortex\resources\locales 에 넣습니다.
  3. 볼텍스에서 Settings 탭으로 들어갑니다.
  4. Interface 항목에서 언어를 한국어로 설정합니다.
  5. 볼텍스를 재시작 하면됩니다.

[b][size=3]Installing Automatically from Vortex[/size][/b]
  1. Sign in to Vortex.
  2. Enter the Settings tab you see on the left.
  3. In the Interface item, set the language to 한국어 (extension by starfield95).
  4. Restart the vortex.

[b][size=3]Installing manually[/size][/b]
  1. Download manually from the File item.
  2. Unzip the en folder and place it in C:\Program Files\Black Tree Gaming Ltd\Vortex\resources\locales.
  3. In the vortex, enter the Settings tab.
  4. In the Interface section, set the language to 한국어.
  5. Restart the vortex.
  

[b]눈에 보이는 대부분의 텍스트는 번역이 완료되었지만, 아직 번역이 진행 중이며, 빠르게 업데이트 할 예정입니다.
Most of the visible text has been translated, but we're still working on it and will update it as soon as we can.[/b]


[color=#00ff00][size=4][b]만약 패치가 잘 적용되지 않는다면, 언어를 영어로 설정하고 아래 폴더를 삭제하고 다시 시도하시면 됩니다.
If the patch doesn't work, you can set the language to English, delete the folder below, and try again.[/b][/size][/color]

  C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\locales\ko
  C:\ProgramData\Vortex\locales\ko

description.short:
Vortex Extension for Steam version of DOOM (2016).

IMPORTANT: The extension will automatically download the DOOM Mod Loader. Change the mod type to "Binaries (Engine Injector)" after it is downloaded.
description.long:
[b][size=3]NOTICE: Bethesda pushed an update to the game on April 11th, 2024, which broke the DOOM Mod Loader's ability to launch the game. You need to add  "+devmode_enable 1" to the Steam launch options and launch from Steam to start the game until this tool is updated. The update also broke mods that depend on DoomLegacyMod. The game will not launch if you have any mods deployed to the game folder like [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/doom/mods/47]Simply Faster Movement 2016[/url], or [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/doom/mods/16]Keep The Dead[/url] that depend on that mod. Make sure you do not have a "dinput8.dll" in the game folder or the game will not launch. [/size]
[/b]
Vortex Extension for Steam version of DOOM (2016). Installs zip files to the correct location for the game to load. Steam version of the game should be found automatically. Other versions of the game may need to specify the installation location manually. 

[b][size=3]IMPORTANT: The extension has been updated to automatically download the DOOM Mod Loader. You need to change the mod type to "Binaries (Engine Injector)" after it is downloaded. I am working on a way to automate this step.
[/size][/b]
Instructions, modified from the [url=https://discord.gg/W9t4nZa]Doom 2016+ Modding Discord[/url]﻿, are below.

[list=1]
[*][u][i][b]Mod Loader Installation:[/b][/i][/u] This extension does this automatically, or you can get it here: [url=https://github.com/jfmherokiller/DOOMExtract/releases/tag/1.8]https://github.com/jfmherokiller/DOOMExtract/releases/tag/1.8[/url]. Download the "Debug.zip" archive, and install it as a mod with mod type "Binaries (Engine Injector)".
[*][u][i][b]Playing With Mods:[/b][/i][/u] Download one or more "mod loader"-based mods from Nexus Mods or elsewhere. Launch the game from Vortex. "It will run the DOOMModLoader.exe and build the mods in the "Mods" folder. Once it's done, it'll automatically run Doom 2016. If you have Doom 2016 on Steam, you should now switch to a Steam window and click "OK" when Steam asks if you want to launch Doom 2016 with some launch arguments.- Running Doom 2016 normally is no longer possible; If Doom 2016 detects any mods while "devMode_enabled" isn't set to 1, Doom 2016 will crash itself. "devMode_enabled" is set to 1 when launching Doom 2016 by running "DOOMModLoader.exe", but note that this disables achievements, multiplayer, and Snapmap. See "Mod Removal" below if you want to earn achievements or play multiplayer or Snapmap.
[*][b][u][i]Mod Removal:[/i][/u] [/b]To uninstall all mods, first Disable them in Vortex, then run the DOOMModLoader.exe (you can do this by launching the game in Vortex).- The mod loader will now get rid of the mod patch files for Doom 2016 (though it'll still try to launch Doom 2016 with "devMode_enabled" set to 1 once it's done removing the mod patch files).- After this, simply launch Doom 2016 normally, and you should be able to play without mods, letting you earn achievements and play multiplayer and snapmap. If you want to play with mods again, see "Playing With Mods" above. 
[/list]


A few things to note:  
[list]
[*]For upscalers, reshades, and other "Engine Injector" type mods, please use the "Binaries (Engine Injector)" mod type.
[/list]





If you would like to support my work you can do so below. Your support is greatly appreciated!

[url=https://buymeacoffee.com/chemboy1]Buy Me a Coffee
[/url]
[url=https://www.patreon.com/chemboy1/membership]Join My Patreon
[/url]

description.short: Vortex Support for Palworld
description.long:
This is an extension for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] to add support for Palworld. The [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/1623730/Palworld/]Steam[/url] and [url=https://www.xbox.com/en-GB/games/store/palworld-game-preview/9NKV34XDW014]Xbox[/url] versions of Palworld are both supported, although there are differences between the two.

[size=3][b]Features
[/b][/size]
[list]
[*]Downloads and installs UE4SS if it doesn't exist
[*]Automatic game detection
[*]Support for PAK mods
[*]Support for Lua\UE4SS mods
[*]Support for Blueprint\Logic mods
[/list]
[size=3][b]Installation
[/b][/size]
This extension requires Vortex 1.9.10 or greater.

To install, click the Vortex button at the top of the Palworld Extension page on Nexus Mods, and then click Install.

You can also manually install it by click the Manual button at the top of the page and dragging it into the drop target labelled Drop File(s) in the Extensions page at the bottom right.

Afterwards, restart Vortex and you can begin installing supported Palworld mods with Vortex.

If you've already got a previous version, the extension should auto update on a Vortex restart.

[b][size=3]Game detection[/size][/b]

The Palworld game extension enables Vortex to automatically locate installs from the Steam and Xbox apps.

It is also possible to manually set the game folder if the auto detection doesn't find the correct installation. A valid Palworld game folder contains:

[list]
[*]Palworld.exe
[/list]
If your game lacks this file then it is likely that your installation has become corrupted somehow.

[b][size=3]Mod Management[/size][/b]

By default, Vortex will deploy files to the game's root folder and extracts the archive while preserving it's folder structure.

[b]PAK mods[/b]

If a PAK mod is detected, it's deployment folder is "\Pal\Content\Paks\~mods".

[b]Lua\UE4SS mods
[/b]
If a LUA mod is detected, it's deployment folder is `\Pal\Binaries\Win64\Mods`.

Starting in v0.1.5 of the Palworld Extension, Lua mods are now added to the `\Pal\Binaries\Win64\Mods\mods.txt` as the primary method for UE4SS detecting that the mod is installed and enabled.

Previously, Vortex created an `enabled.txt` within the individual mods folder. This has since been proven to cause problems with collections and so now uses the above `mods.txt` method.

[b]Blueprint\Logic mods[/b]

If a Blueprint\Logic mod is detected, it's deployment folder is `\Pal\Content\Paks\LogicMods`. These mods are detected by reading the contents of the PAK file and looking at it's mount point. If this fails, then Vortex falls back to looking for the existence of a `LogicMods` folder within the archive.

[b]Unsupported mods[/b]

Vortex doesn't officially support managing of mods that are reshades, save game\config edits or require external tools (apart from UE4SS and UnrealPakTool).
[size=3][b]
Known Issues
[/b][/size]
Due to erroneous metadata on Nexus Mods, the download file for UE4SS 3.0.0 might point to a different game and raise a notification. It is completely safe to ignore this.

[size=3][b]See also[/b][/size]

[list]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/palworld]Mods for Palworld (Nexus Mods)[/url]﻿
[*][url=https://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/forum/4306-vortex-support/]Vortex Forum (Nexus Mods)[/url]
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Download Vortex (Nexus Mods)[/url]﻿
[/list]
[b][size=3]Thanks[/size][/b]

[list]
[*]The [url=https://github.com/UE4SS-RE/RE-UE4SS]UE4SS [/url]﻿team for doing an amazing job.
[*][url=https://github.com/allcoolthingsatoneplace/UnrealPakTool]UnrealPakTool [/url]﻿for enabling us to peek inside the PAK files.
[*][url=https://github.com/Khejanin]Khejanin [/url]﻿for helping with PAK type detection.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/users/1077141]Êçhëłøñ[/url]﻿ for help with testing and performing some great deep dives into mod types and patterns.
[/list]

description.short: Adds Vortex support for Made in Abyss: Binary Star Falling into Darkness. Supports the following mods: basic pak mods, UE4SS Lua mods, and UE4SS Blueprint mods.
description.long:
[size=4]Features[/size]

[list]
[*][b]Supports pak mods, UE4SS Lua mods, and UE4SS Blueprint mods.[/b]
[*][b]Mod installation convenience.[/b] Simply drag and drop / [i]Install From File...[/i] the zip file, and as long as it is any of the mods supported above and in the right format, it'll get handled automatically.
[*][b]Leaves the game directory untouched.[/b] You can Enable / Disable mods as you will, etc. and the base game files shouldn't get affected.
[/list]
[size=4]Installation
[/size]
[list=1]
[*]Download [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url].
[*]Launch Vortex then go to Games
[*]Search for "Made in Abyss" and then click Manage.
[*]It will say that you don't have the game extension yet. Download it.
[/list]
Vortex will restart and you'll see that the game extension has been installed!

[color=#ffff00]Sometimes, it will say that it was unable to find the game location. If so, point it to [font=Courier New]\steamapps\common\MadeInAbyss-BSFD\[/font][/color]

[size=4]Creating mods that are compatible with Vortex and the game extension[/size]

The game extension supports three kinds of mods: basic pak mods, UE4SS Lua mods, and UE4SS Blueprint mods. [b]All mods must be inside a .zip file.[/b]

If these are followed, your mods should be handled by the game extension just fine.

Note: Only these types of files will be extracted from the mod zip: .pak, .txt, .dll, .ini, and .lua.

[size=3].pak mods
[/size]
Simply put your .pak files inside the .zip file, in the root.

[size=3]UE4SS Lua Mods[/size]

Ensure that the .zip file contains at least the following:
[code]Mods/modname/Scripts/main.lua
Mods/modname/enabled.txt
[/code]
[size=3]UE4SS Blueprint Mods[/size]

Similar to the .pak mods, except that it must be placed inside a LogicMods folder.

extensions.name: Made in Abyss - Binary Star Falling into Darkness Support

description.short: Adds support for The Universim to Vortex, enabling you to easily automate installation of mods for The Universim without having to worry about where the files are supposed to go, etc.
description.long:
This extension adds support for The Universim to [[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex Mod Manager[/url]], enabling you to easily automate installation of mods for The Universim without having to worry about where the files are supposed to go, etc.

At this time, the following mod types are supported:

- BepInEx Pack for The Universim
- BepInEx plugins
- BepInEx patchers

If you are developing a different kind of mod and would like it to be supported by this extension, please [raise an issue or pull request on the GitHub [url=https://github.com/MrPurple6411/The-Universim-Support/issues]repository [/url]with a link to your mod page so that I can take a look at how you are packaging it. Please make sure to include instructions for how you would expect it to be installed, so that I can have Vortex automate the process. PRs welcome!

## How to install

This extension requires [[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url]] ^1.8.0. To install, click the Vortex button at the top of this page to open this extension within Vortex, and then click `Install`. Alternatively, within Vortex, go to the `Extensions` tab, click "`Find More`" at the bottom of the tab, search for "The Universim Support" and then click `Install`.

You can also manually install it by downloading the main file and dragging it into the "drop zone" labelled "`Drop File(s)`" in the `Extensions` tab at the bottom right.

Afterwards, restart Vortex and you can begin installing supported The Universim mods with Vortex.

***

[color=#ff0000][size=5]The rest of this page is intended for mod authors only.
Users can simply follow the instructions above to install, and you're done![/size][/color]

***

## How to make my mod compatible with this extension?

Assuming your mod is of a supported type, simply follow the packaging examples for that mod type below.

Don't forget to set your latest main file as your main Vortex file, and make sure that the "`Remove the 'Download with Manager' button`" option is unticked!

If your mod is not of a supported type, you will need to [raise an issue or pull request on the GitHub [url=https://github.com/MrPurple6411/The-Universim-Support/issues]repository[/url] with a link to your mod page so that I can take a look at how you are packaging it. Please make sure to include instructions for how you would expect it to be installed.

### Packaging examples

#### BepInEx plugins

Any of the following structures are valid:

```
- MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- My BepInEx Plugin
  - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- plugins
  - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- plugins
  - My BepInEx Plugin
    - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- BepInEx
  - plugins
      - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- BepInEx
  - plugins
    - My BepInEx Plugin
      - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

#### BepInEx patchers

Any of the following structures are valid:

```
- patchers
  - MyBepInExPatcher.dll
```

```
- patchers
  - My BepInEx Patcher
    - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- BepInEx
  - patchers
      - MyBepInExPatcher.dll
```

```
- BepInEx
  - patchers
    - My BepInEx Patcher
      - MyBepInExPatcher.dll
```

#### BepInEx plugin/patcher combos

Any of the following structures are valid:

```
- patchers
  - MyBepInExPatcher.dll
- plugins
  - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- patchers
  - My Mod Name
    - MyBepInExPatcher.dll
- plugins
  - My Mod Name
    - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- BepInEx
  - patchers
    - MyBepInExPatcher.dll
  - plugins
    - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```

```
- BepInEx
  - patchers
    - My Mod Name
      - MyBepInExPatcher.dll
  - plugins
    - My Mod Name
      - MyBepInExPlugin.dll
```


#### My mod is being installed strangely!

If you have followed the packaging examples above and your mod is still being incorrectly installed by this extension, please [raise an issue on the GitHub [url=https://github.com/MrPurple6411/The-Universim-Support/issues]repository [/url]with a link to your mod page or with a sample archive attached so that I can get it fixed.

description.short: Adds support for Like a Dragon Infinite Wealth.
description.long:
This extension adds RyuModManager support to Vortex for Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth. [url=https://github.com/GarnetSunset/vortex_mo2_yakuza_plugins]Source code[/url] can be found here.

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/likeadragoninfinitewealth]Nexus Mods page for Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth[/url]

[b][size=3]Requirements[/size]

[/b][url=https://github.com/SRMM-Studio/ShinRyuModManager/releases/latest]ShinRyuModManager [/url](v4.0+) has to be installed to the game directory and ran at least once. The
extension will show a notification if this has not been done yet.

[b][size=3]Installing

[/size][/b]Select "Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth" from the games list in Vortex and download the extension.

If you can't find the game in Vortex yet, then you can download the
extension from the files section on this page and extract it to ﻿this
path:

[size=3][i]C:\Users\[/i]<your-username>[i]\AppData\Roaming\Vortex\plugins\[i]game-[/i][/i][i]likeadragoninfinitewealth[/i][/size]
[i]
[/i]Or this path:

[i][size=3]%appdata%\Vortex\plugins\game-[/size][/i][size=3][i]likeadragoninfinitewealth[/i][/size]

[size=3][b]Usage

[/b][/size]You can now use the [b]Mod Manager Download [/b]option when downloading mods. All mods that mention [b]RyuModManager [/b](or [b]RMM[/b]) in their description should be compatible with this extension. If a mod
does not have that option, then you can still download it manually and
drag its file to the mods tab in Vortex.

Vortex will show an error if the mod that was downloaded is not supported/has an invalid
format. In that case, you can either install it manually or ask the mod
author to reupload the mod with RMM support.

You can even convert an unsupported mod yourself, by following [url=https://github.com/SutandoTsukai181/RyuModManager/wiki/Creating-A-New-Mod]these instructions[/url]. All it requires is some basic understanding of the game's data
directory layout (which you can get by reading the instructions). After
repackaging the mod, you can install it to Vortex manually by dragging
it to the mods tab in Vortex.

[size=4]RyuModManager has to be run before launching the game whenever you install/enable/disable any mods.[/size]

[b][size=3]Credits[/size][/b]

This extension was mostly based on the tutorial extension from [url=https://modding.wiki/en/vortex/developer/create-a-game-extension]here[/url] and the Subnautica extension, so huge thanks to their authors.

[size=3][b]Support﻿

[/b][/size]Please put any questions you may have in the posts section.

Feel free to join the [url=https://discord.com/invite/yakuzamodding]Yakuza Modding Community[/url] Discord server for more help about using RyuModManager and installing mods.

description.short: This Vortex extension enables mod management for "Destroy All Humans! 2 - Reprobed," auto-detecting the game via Steam and GOG IDs, ensuring mod directories exist, and facilitating correct mod installations to enhance gameplay seamlessly.
description.long: This Vortex extension provides comprehensive support for "Destroy All Humans! 2 - Reprobed" by automating the discovery of the game's installation, ensuring mod directories are in place, and streamlining the mod installation process. It manages mods by ensuring a writable `~mods` folder within the game's `Paks` directory, where mod files are stored. Users can easily manage their mods through Vortex, with the extension taking care of the necessary setup, like validating game files and setting up the modding environment, making modding accessible even for those less familiar with the game's directory structure.

description.short: Adds management and load order support for .pak mods to Vortex Mod Manager for Ready Or Not game.
description.long:
This [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] extension adds mod management and load order support for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/readyornot]Ready Or Not[/url]. Extension is based on and uses Pickysaurus [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/153]Unreal Engine Mod Installer[/url]﻿.

[size=4]Installation[/size]

In Vortex, simply go to the Games section, find Ready Or Not tile, click on "Manage", and follow the prompts to install the extension and restart
Vortex. If a prompt appears to install the Unreal Engine Mod Installer, click "Fix" in the prompt and restart Vortex once more.

You can also enable advanced mode in Vortex's settings, download the ZIP archive from the Files tab above, and drop the archive into Vortex's Extensions
section. You can even do it more manually by extracting the ZIP archive to a custom subfolder in Vortex's plugins folder (likely %APPDATA%\Vortex\plugins).

Source code: https://github.com/BeYkeRYkt/vortex_readyornot_extension

description.short: Vortex support for FATE
description.long:
[size=4]Vortex Extension for FATE[/size]

This is an extension for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Vortex[/url] to add support for FATE. This is available for the PC from [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/246840/FATE/]Steam[/url], [url=https://www.gog.com/game/FATE]GOG[/url], and [url=http://games.wildtangent.com/fate/]WildTangent[/url]﻿, as well as the original game disc. The extension is only tested with Steam, but should be compatible with the other installations as well.
[size=3]
[b]Game detection[/b][/size]

The FATE game extension enables Vortex to automatically locate the installation directory from Steam's library.
It is also possible to manually set the game folder if the auto detection doesn't find the correct installation. A valid FATE game folder contains:

[code]/fate.exe
[/code]
If your game lacks this file then it is likely that your installation has become corrupted somehow.

[b][size=3]Requirements[/size][/b]:

FATE doesn't support automatic mod installation normally. Please download and install [b][i][u][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fate/mods/21][b][size=3]Fate Patcher Core[/size][/b][/url][/u][/i][/b] and install to the game directory manually.
When Vortex deploys your mods, it will prepare them for this utility; launch the tool from the tools category to integrate the mods into your game. You will be provided a link to download FPX Core when the extension loads, as well as when you deploy mods, if this utility's executable is missing from the game's root directory.

[size=3][b]Mod Management[/b]
[/size]
The mods will be deployed to the game's mod folder (the [u][i]/mods[/i][/u] directory) and will respect the folder structure within the archive file (which should be single-nested before the mod's patch file). To integrate the mods into your game, run the Fate Patcher Core utility.

Deployment method MUST be hardlink; the symlink method is NOT compatible with Fate Patcher Core's plugin loading system at this time.

[size=3][b]To Do[/b][/size][size=2]:
[/size]
Auto-run Fate Patcher Core after mod deployment
[size=3]
[b]See also[/b][/size]
- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fate?tab=latest]NexusMods FATE Repository[/url].
- [url=https://pctalk.info/Games/FATE/Pages/ModsByAuthor.php]Original Modding Website[/url].

- [url=https://discord.gg/WFhx8SmAWz]FATE Modding Discord Community
[img]https://i.imgur.com/972EjKy.png[/img][/url]


- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/about/vortex/]Download Vortex (Nexus Mods)[/url]
- [url=https://wiki.nexusmods.com/index.php/Category:Vortex]Vortex Knowledge Base (Nexus Mods)[/url]
