description.short:
This extension adds Vortex mod support for Dragon's Dogma 2.

*** This extension is intended to be used in combination with Fluffy Mod Manager. That mod will install automatically after installing this extension, along with REFramework.
description.long:
This extension adds Vortex mod support for Dragon's Dogma 2.  Should automatically detect the installation location for the Steam version of the game. Other versions will need to specify the game folder manually when activating the game. 

This extension is intended to be used in combination with[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/818] Fluffy Mod Manager[/url] (FMM). That mod will install automatically after installing this extension, along with REFramework (for plugins and script mods).

Mod Installation Notes:
[list]
[*].pak mods run through an installer that places them in the staging folder for Fluffy Mod Manager (set as mod type "Fluffy Mod Manager").  A tool is included for FMM in the extension. You need to load up FMM after installing a .pak mod in Vortex to get it packed into the game files. 
[*]﻿If the .pak mods are not packaged in a single folder with all the .pak's together, you may need to do some manual file manipulation to get things the way you want them. It is not really possible for me to account for multiple folders with .pak mods in the installer, so please keep this in mind.
[*]Installs target the root folder for the game as the default mod installation location (same as the executable location) for any non-pak mods. Be sure to set up your mod folders properly per individual mod instructions.
[/list]

Planned improvements:
[list]
[*]REFramework .lua Script Mods Installer (99% Done) - I have not yet implemented this installer as I was not sure if it would be beneficial. It seems most mods on Nexus are packaged correctly to install scripts when going into the root game folder, but there are a few out there that don't.
[*].pak Mod Installer - DONE - automatically extract and place .pak mods in the correct folder for Fluffy Mod Manager - this will work well for most mods, but there are some that are packaged such that you may need to do some manual file manipulation.
[*]Automatic Fluffy Mod Manager & REFramework mods installation - DONE - automatically download Fluffy Mod Manger and REFramework at startup if they are not in the mods list.
[/list]

Credit goes to [url=https://next.nexusmods.com/profile/Nagev/about-me]Nagev[/url] for assisting me in some of the functions used in this extension. 


If you would like to support my work you can do so below. Your support is greatly appreciated!

[url=https://buymeacoffee.com/chemboy1]Buy Me a Coffee
[/url]
[url=https://www.patreon.com/chemboy1/membership]Join My Patreon

[/url]

description.short:
Adds Battlefield 1 support to Vortex. Note that FrostyToolSuite's Frosty Mod Manager is required. Install it as a mod with mod type "Binaries (Engine Injector)".

You must have Steam and/or EA App open when launching the game from Vortex in order for mods to load and the game to start.
description.long:
Add Battlefield 1 support to Vortex. Note that FrostyToolSuite's Frosty Mod Manager is required. Install it as a mod as "Binaries (Engine Injector)".

Frostbite Engine mods (.fbmods) will be installed to the default folder that Frosty Mod Manager uses (when Frosty is unzipped to the game's root folder). So basically, this extension allows you to download mods from Nexus and pass them directly to Frosty MM in the correct folder, so you don't have to move files around manually. 

For any upscalers, reshades, etc. use mod type "Binaries (Engine Injector)" to place the files next to the game executable in the root installation folder. 


[size=4][url=https://github.com/CadeEvs/FrostyToolsuite/releases/tag/v1.0.6.3]https://github.com/CadeEvs/FrostyToolsuite/releases/tag/v1.0.6.3[/url] [/size][size=4]
[/size]
[b][size=4]INSTALL FROSTY MOD MANAGER AS A MOD WITH MOD TYPE "Binaries (Engine Injector)"
[/size][/b]
﻿A few things to note:  
[list]
[*][b][size=3]You must have Steam and/or EA App open when launching the game from Vortex in order for mods to load and the game to start.[/size][/b]
[/list]

[b][size=3]Credits:
[/size][/b]
Thanks to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/users/2293947]alistair3149[/url]﻿ and his [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/112]extension for Battlefront II[/url], which was very helpful in making this extension

description.short: Adds Vortex support for Warhammer: Vermintide 2. Note that traditional mods are available in Steam Workshop for this title. This extension is for installing reshades, upscalers, and other mods.
description.long:
Adds Vortex support for Warhammer: Vermintide 2. Note that traditional mods are available in Steam Workshop for this title. This extension is for installing reshades, upscalers, and other mods.

﻿A few things to note:  
[list]
[*]As stated above, most mods for this game are available through Steam Workshop. This extension is for installing reshades, upscalers, and other mods not available on Steam Workshop. 
[*]Note that due to Anti-Cheat you can only use these types of mods in the Modded Realm. Reshades work fine in the Official Realm.
[/list]

description.short: Allows you to make a new, blank mod inside Vortex without messing with the staging folder directly.
description.long:
This extension adds a toolbar button to the Mods tab which allows for a new, empty mod to be created. Useful if you want to add files you created yourself or need a new mod to keep the items you intend to bundle with a collection.

I wanted to be able to do this in Vortex so I made a quick and basic extension to do so.
